original: de lta bas na de'i skyon yongs su spang ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i phyir nyon la legs par rab tu yid la byos shig ces gsungs pa yin pas na mnyan pa'i skyon de bdag cag la 'byung na mi rung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bas na de'i skyon yongs su spang ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i phyir nyon la legs par rab tu yid la byos shig ces gsungs pa yin pas na mnyan pa'i skyon de bdag cag la 'byung na mi rung ba'i phyir /
translated: Since it is not suitable for us to have the fault of listening,

original: gus par chos mnyan par bya'o //
analyzed: gus par chos mnyan par bya'o //
translated: we should listen to the Dharma with respect.

original: nad pa gcig gis ni sman pa'i lung ma shes la /
analyzed: nad pa gcig gis ni sman pa'i lung ma shes la /
translated: One patient does not understand the doctor’s instructions,

original: gnyis pas ni nyes par bzung ste /
analyzed: gnyis pas ni nyes par bzung ste /
translated: and the other misinterprets them.

original: dper na 'khrus pa la 'bras khu lud cig ces bsgo ba las /
analyzed: dper na 'khrus pa la 'bras khu lud cig ces bsgo ba las /
translated: For example, when told to drink rice water for diarrhea,

original: zho ga chu blud pa dang / drod chung ba la phye ma sbyar ba las phyung ste /
analyzed: zho ga chu blud pa dang / drod chung ba la phye ma sbyar ba las phyung ste /
translated: one drinks yogurt and water, and the other drinks flour and water.

original: pho sum re re 'goms shig ces bsgo ba las rgyun mi 'chad par thams cad 'gams ba dang / 'di ltar snum thong la 'di ltar bkru sman 'thungs shig /'thungs nas kyang 'di ltar @116b 'bras khu dang / thug pa la sogs pa rim gyis longs spyod cig ces bsgo ba las /
analyzed: pho sum re re 'goms shig ces bsgo ba las rgyun mi 'chad par thams cad 'gams ba dang / 'di ltar snum thong la 'di ltar bkru sman 'thungs shig /'thungs nas kyang 'di ltar @116b 'bras khu dang / thug pa la sogs pa rim gyis longs spyod cig ces bsgo ba las /
translated: The king ordered, You must be anointed with this oil, drink this medicine, and after drinking it, eat this rice soup, porridge, and so on, in sequence.

original: nyi ma gcig nyid la thams cad byas so //
analyzed: nyi ma gcig nyid la thams cad byas so //
translated: But they did all of it in a single day.

original: gsum pas ni legs par bzung nas chud gzan pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: gsum pas ni legs par bzung nas chud gzan pa lta bu ste /
translated: The third is like holding something well and then letting it go.

original: de rnams las bar ma ni thams cad pas tha chad yin no //
analyzed: de rnams las bar ma ni thams cad pas tha chad yin no //
translated: Among them, the middling is the worst of all.

original: bstan pa 'di la yang gang zag de lta bu gsum yod pas de'i gnyen por bcom ldan 'das kyis nyon la legs pa dang / rab tu yid la bya bas mnyan pa la yang dag par gzung pa mdzad do //
analyzed: bstan pa 'di la yang gang zag de lta bu gsum yod pas de'i gnyen por bcom ldan 'das kyis nyon la legs pa dang / rab tu yid la bya bas mnyan pa la yang dag par gzung pa mdzad do //
translated: Since there are three such types of persons in this teaching, the Bhagavān, as their antidote, said, “Listen well and thoroughly take it to mind,” and taught them to listen with respect.

original: de lta bas na nad pa lta bur gyur na mi rung bas gus par chos mnyan par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na nad pa lta bur gyur na mi rung bas gus par chos mnyan par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, since it is not suitable to be like a patient, one should listen to the Dharma with respect.

original: nad pa gsum po dag ni phal gnod de /
analyzed: nad pa gsum po dag ni phal gnod de /
translated: The three types of patients are generally harmful.

original: zas mi za ba gang yin pa dang / mi 'phrod pa za ba gang yin pa dang / 'phrod pa zos pa skyugs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: zas mi za ba gang yin pa dang / mi 'phrod pa za ba gang yin pa dang / 'phrod pa zos pa skyugs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Not eating the right food, eating the wrong food, and vomiting food that has been eaten.

original: de bzhin du nyon mongs pa'i nad pa rnams kyang chos kyi yab sangs rgyas la gnod de /
analyzed: de bzhin du nyon mongs pa'i nad pa rnams kyang chos kyi yab sangs rgyas la gnod de /
translated: Likewise, those who are sick with the disease of the afflictions also harm the Dharma King, the Buddha.

original: dam pa'i chos mi nyan pa gang yin pa dang / tshul bzhin yid la mi byed pa gang yin pa dang / legs par yid la med pa'i phyir brjed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos mi nyan pa gang yin pa dang / tshul bzhin yid la mi byed pa gang yin pa dang / legs par yid la med pa'i phyir brjed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Not listening to the holy Dharma, not attending properly to it, and forgetting it because of not attending to it properly.

original: de lta bas na chos kyi yab sangs rgyas la gnod par gyur na mi rung pas /
analyzed: de lta bas na chos kyi yab sangs rgyas la gnod par gyur na mi rung pas /
translated: Therefore, since it is not right to harm the Dharma King, the Buddha,

original: gus par mnyan par bya'o //
analyzed: gus par mnyan par bya'o //
translated: you should listen respectfully.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos mnyan pa la phan yon lnga gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos mnyan pa la phan yon lnga gsungs te /
translated: The Blessed One has taught that listening to the Dharma has five benefits.

original: ma thos pa thos par 'gyur ba dang / thos pa yongs su byang bar 'gyur ba dang / som nyi spong ba dang / lta ba drang por byed pa dang / shes rab kyis don dang / tshig zab mo rtogs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ma thos pa thos par 'gyur ba dang / thos pa yongs su byang bar 'gyur ba dang / som nyi spong ba dang / lta ba drang por byed pa dang / shes rab kyis don dang / tshig zab mo rtogs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: one will hear what one has not heard, one will purify what one has heard, one will abandon doubt, one will straighten out one's views, and one will understand the profound meaning and words with wisdom.

original: de la ji ltar na ma thos pa thos par 'gyur ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na ma thos pa thos par 'gyur ba yin zhe na /
translated: How does one hear what one has not heard?

original: thog ma med pa can gyi 'khor ba nas bstan bcos gzhan thams cad las ma thos pa phung po dang / skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang /
analyzed: thog ma med pa can gyi 'khor ba nas bstan bcos gzhan thams cad las ma thos pa phung po dang / skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang /
translated: From beginningless cyclic existence, one has not heard from any other treatise the aggregates, sense spheres, elements, dependent origination, noble truths, establishments of mindfulness,

original: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang ; byang chub kyi yan lag dang / dbugs rngubs pa dang / 'byung ba dran pa dang / bslab pa dang / shes nas dad pa rnam par gzhag pa dang /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang ; byang chub kyi yan lag dang / dbugs rngubs pa dang / 'byung ba dran pa dang / bslab pa dang / shes nas dad pa rnam par gzhag pa dang /
translated: right efforts, legs of supernatural power, faculties, powers, limbs of awakening, mindfulness of inhalation and exhalation, trainings, and presentation of faith through knowledge.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams kyi bar dang spyi dang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid phyin ci ma log pa ston pa @117a * //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams kyi bar dang spyi dang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid phyin ci ma log pa ston pa @117a * //
translated: He teaches the characteristics of the general, the causes and effects of all the phenomena of defilement and purification,

original: dang / bdag tu lta ba'i nye bar len pa spong ba yongs su ston pa dang / gang zag slob pa dang / mi slob pa'i bar du dbye ba dang / che ba'i bdag nyid dang / dge sbyong gi 'bras bu dang / rnam par thar pa dang /
analyzed: dang / bdag tu lta ba'i nye bar len pa spong ba yongs su ston pa dang / gang zag slob pa dang / mi slob pa'i bar du dbye ba dang / che ba'i bdag nyid dang / dge sbyong gi 'bras bu dang / rnam par thar pa dang /
translated: He teaches the abandonment of the appropriation of the view of self, the classification of the person from the learner to the adept, the greatness, the fruits of the spiritual life,

original: zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched dang / zad par gyi skye mched dang / nyon mongs pa med pa dang / smon nas shes pa la sogs pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa dang /
analyzed: zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched dang / zad par gyi skye mched dang / nyon mongs pa med pa dang / smon nas shes pa la sogs pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa dang /
translated: the liberations, the spheres of mastery, the spheres of totality, the analytical knowledges, the discriminations, the controlling faculties, the powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, the exclusive qualities of the Buddha,

original: che ba'i bdag nyid la sogs pa gang yin pa de thos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: che ba'i bdag nyid la sogs pa gang yin pa de thos par 'gyur ro //
translated: the greatnesses, etc.

original: de ltar na ma thos pa thos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na ma thos pa thos par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus he hears what he has not heard.

original: ji ltar na thos pa yongs su byang bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na thos pa yongs su byang bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does one purify what one has heard?

original: sangs rgyas 'byung ba gzhan dag las sam /
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'byung ba gzhan dag las sam /
translated: By hearing the Dharma from other Buddhas.

original: 'dir thos pa brjod dam /
analyzed: 'dir thos pa brjod dam /
translated: Or by hearing it from others here.

original: dri ma can du gyur pa gang yin pa de mnyan pas gsal bar byed cing dri ma med par byed do //
analyzed: dri ma can du gyur pa gang yin pa de mnyan pas gsal bar byed cing dri ma med par byed do //
translated: What is defiled is purified by hearing, and becomes clear and undefiled.

original: de ltar na thos pa yongs su byang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na thos pa yongs su byang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way one purifies what one has heard.

original: ji ltar na som nyi spong bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na som nyi spong bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does one abandon doubt?

original: de sems pa na the tshom 'byung ba gang yin pa de /
analyzed: de sems pa na the tshom 'byung ba gang yin pa de /
translated: When one thinks, doubt arises.

original: chos mnyan pas nges pa 'thob bo //
analyzed: chos mnyan pas nges pa 'thob bo //
translated: By hearing the Dharma, one obtains certainty.

original: ji ltar na lta ba drang por byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar na lta ba drang por byed ce na /
translated: How does one straighten out one's views?

original: 'dis sems pa na log par rtog pa 'byung ba gang yin pa de yang dag par rtog go //
analyzed: 'dis sems pa na log par rtog pa 'byung ba gang yin pa de yang dag par rtog go //
translated: When one thinks, wrong views arise.

original: ji ltar na shes rab kyis don dang tshig zab mo rtogs par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na shes rab kyis don dang tshig zab mo rtogs par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does one understand the profound meaning and the profound expression by means of wisdom?

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos nyid gang thos nas /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos nyid gang thos nas /
translated: When one hears the true nature of dependent origination,

original: chos nyid rtogs par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: chos nyid rtogs par 'gyur zhing /
translated: one understands the true nature.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa mngon par rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa mngon par rtogs par byed do //
translated: One realizes the noble truths.

original: phan yon lnga po 'di dag gis shes rab gsum yongs su dag par bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: phan yon lnga po 'di dag gis shes rab gsum yongs su dag par bstan pa yin te /
translated: These five benefits show the purification of the three wisdoms.

original: ma thos pa thos par 'gyur ba dang / thos pa yongs su byang bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa des ni thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab yongs su dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma thos pa thos par 'gyur ba dang / thos pa yongs su byang bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa des ni thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab yongs su dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: The purification of the wisdom arisen from listening is the elimination of what has not been heard and the purification of what has been heard.

original: som nyi spong ba dang / lta ba drang por byed pa gang yin pa des ni bsams pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: som nyi spong ba dang / lta ba drang por byed pa gang yin pa des ni bsams pa las byung ba'o //
translated: The purification of the wisdom arisen from contemplation is the elimination of doubt and the straightening of views.

original: shes rab kyis don dang / tshig zab mo rtogs par 'gyur ba gang yin pa des ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab yongs su dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyis don dang / tshig zab mo rtogs par 'gyur ba gang yin pa des ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab yongs su dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: The purification of the wisdom arisen from meditation is the realization of the profound meaning and words through wisdom.

original: phan yon 'di dag yang dag par mthong bas dam pa'i chos mnyan pa las gus par mnyan par bya'o //
analyzed: phan yon 'di dag yang dag par mthong bas dam pa'i chos mnyan pa las gus par mnyan par bya'o //
translated: Seeing these benefits, one should listen respectfully to the holy Dharma.

original: yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: thos pas chos rnams @117b shes par 'gyur //
analyzed: thos pas chos rnams @117b shes par 'gyur //
translated: Through listening, one knows the Dharma.

original: thos pas sdig las ldog par 'gyur //
analyzed: thos pas sdig las ldog par 'gyur //
translated: Through learning one turns away from evil.

original: thos bas don med spong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: thos bas don med spong bar 'gyur //
translated: Through learning one abandons what is meaningless.

original: thos pas mya ngan 'das pa 'thob //🔽ces gsungs pas so //
analyzed: thos pas mya ngan 'das pa 'thob // ces gsungs pas so //
translated: Through learning one attains nirvana.

original: de la ji ltar na thos pas chos rnams shes par 'gyur zhe na /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na thos pas chos rnams shes par 'gyur zhe na / 'di lta ste /
translated: How does one know the Dharma through learning?

original: 'di na kha cig de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba thos na yang dag pa'i tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab yongs su ston pa gang yin pa 'di de kho na chos yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di na kha cig de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba thos na yang dag pa'i tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab yongs su ston pa gang yin pa 'di de kho na chos yin gyi /
translated: Here, someone hears the Dharma and Vinaya taught by the Tathāgata, and knows that this is the Dharma: the teaching on right morality, concentration, and wisdom.

original: gzhan mu stegs can gyis smras pa me dang chur 'jug pa dang / zas mi za ba dang / brtul zhugs drag po dang / 'tshe ba dang / mchod sbyin la sogs pa yongs su ston pa ni ma yin no zhes rnam par shes so //
analyzed: gzhan mu stegs can gyis smras pa me dang chur 'jug pa dang / zas mi za ba dang / brtul zhugs drag po dang / 'tshe ba dang / mchod sbyin la sogs pa yongs su ston pa ni ma yin no zhes rnam par shes so //
translated: But the teachings of other tīrthikas, such as entering fire and water, fasting, severe austerities, harming, and sacrificial offerings, are not the Dharma.

original: ji ltar na thos pas sdig pa las ldog par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na thos pas sdig pa las ldog par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does one turn away from evil through learning?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Here, someone hears the Dharma and Vinaya taught by the Tathāgata, and knows that this is the Dharma: the teaching on right morality, concentration, and wisdom.

original: 'di na kha cig de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba las lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa thos na /
analyzed: 'di na kha cig de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba las lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa thos na /
translated: Here, some people, having heard about the training in superior morality from the Dharma and Vinaya taught by the Tathāgata,

original: de la brten pas nyes par spyod pa las ldog go //
analyzed: de la brten pas nyes par spyod pa las ldog go //
translated: refrain from misconduct on the basis of that training.

original: ji ltar na thos pas don med pa spong bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na thos pas don med pa spong bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does hearing the Dharma eliminate that which is meaningless?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this.

original: 'di na kha cig de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba las lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa thos na /
analyzed: 'di na kha cig de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba las lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa thos na /
translated: Here, some people, having heard about the training in superior mind from the Dharma and Vinaya taught by the Tathāgata,

original: de la brten pas gang dag la byis pa rnams don du 'du shes pa 'dod pa don med par gyur pa rnams spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la brten pas gang dag la byis pa rnams don du 'du shes pa 'dod pa don med par gyur pa rnams spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: on the basis of that training, they abandon that which is meaningless, namely, those objects that fools imagine to be meaningful.

original: ji ltar na thos pas mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar na thos pas mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob ce na /
translated: How does hearing the Dharma lead to the attainment of nirvāṇa?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this.

original: 'di na kha cig de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba las lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa thos na /
analyzed: 'di na kha cig de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba las lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa thos na /
translated: Here, some people, having heard about the training in superior wisdom from the Dharma and Vinaya taught by the Tathāgata,

original: de la brten pas zag pa zad pa mngon sum du byed do //
analyzed: de la brten pas zag pa zad pa mngon sum du byed do //
translated: on the basis of that training, they manifest the destruction of the contaminants.

original: 'dis ni dam pa'i chos mnyan pa la phan yon rnam pa bzhi po yang dag pa'i lta ba rnyed pa dang / bslab pa gsum la yang dag par brten pas /
analyzed: 'dis ni dam pa'i chos mnyan pa la phan yon rnam pa bzhi po yang dag pa'i lta ba rnyed pa dang / bslab pa gsum la yang dag par brten pas /
translated: one acquires the right view, one relies on the three trainings,

original: sdig pa las yang dag par rgal ba dang / 'dod pa las yang dag par rgal ba dang / yang srid pa las yang dag par rgal ba yod par go rims bzhin du yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: sdig pa las yang dag par rgal ba dang / 'dod pa las yang dag par rgal ba dang / yang srid pa las yang dag par rgal ba yod par go rims bzhin du yongs su bstan to //
translated: one crosses over evil, one crosses over desire, and one crosses over becoming.

original: yang nyon mongs pa'i gnod pa'i rgyus phan yon rnam pa bzhi po yang dag pa'i lta ba rnyed pa dang / las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa las rgal ba dang / nyon mongs @118a * //
analyzed: yang nyon mongs pa'i gnod pa'i rgyus phan yon rnam pa bzhi po yang dag pa'i lta ba rnyed pa dang / las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa las rgal ba dang / nyon mongs @118a * //
translated: Moreover, the four benefits of listening to the holy Dharma are shown:

original: pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa las rgal ba dang / skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa las rgal ba yod par yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa las rgal ba dang / skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa las rgal ba yod par yongs su bstan to //
translated: one acquires the right view, one crosses over the defilement of action, one crosses over the defilement of the passions, and one crosses over the defilement of birth.

original: yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Moreover, there are four benefits:

original: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la dad pa rnyed pa dang / rab tu 'byung ba dang / dbang po'i sgo bsrungs pa nyid kyi rim pas bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar du ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la dad pa rnyed pa dang / rab tu 'byung ba dang / dbang po'i sgo bsrungs pa nyid kyi rim pas bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar du ste /
translated: and the Dharma and Vinaya taught by the Tathagata, and the stages of guarding the sense doors, up to the four dhyanas.

original: de ni 'dod pa'i khams las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni 'dod pa'i khams las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir /
translated: Because of being free from attachment to the desire realm,

original: gnod pa spong ba dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa'i rim pas zag pa zad pa'i bar du ste /
analyzed: gnod pa spong ba dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa'i rim pas zag pa zad pa'i bar du ste /
translated: the stages of abandoning harm and fully knowing the noble truths just as they are, up to the exhaustion of defilements.

original: n+ya gro dha la sogs pa'i mdo sde rnams kyis bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: n+ya gro dha la sogs pa'i mdo sde rnams kyis bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: This should be established by the Nyagrodha and other sutras.

original: de ltar phan yon rnam pa mang po yang dag par mthong ba nyid kyis gus par chos mnyan par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar phan yon rnam pa mang po yang dag par mthong ba nyid kyis gus par chos mnyan par bya'o //
translated: Thus, by seeing the many benefits, one should respectfully listen to the Dharma.

original: yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Again, why is that?

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyi chos 'dul ba ni legs par gsungs pa yin pas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyi chos 'dul ba ni legs par gsungs pa yin pas so //
translated: Because the Blessed One's Dharma and Vinaya are well-spoken.

original: yang ji ltar na legs par gsungs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar na legs par gsungs pa yin zhe na /
translated: Again, how is it well-spoken?

original: rnam pa bcu dag gis te /
analyzed: rnam pa bcu dag gis te /

original: pa'i phyir ro //

original: mi zhan pa ni bsnyengs pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi zhan pa ni bsnyengs pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not weak, because it is free from fear.

original: rab tu dga' ba ni mi skyo ba'i phyir ro //🔽khyab pa ni rig pa'i gnas thams cad la mkhas pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba ni mi skyo ba'i phyir ro // khyab pa ni rig pa'i gnas thams cad la mkhas pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not discouraged, because it is not weary.🔽It is pervasive, because it is endowed with skill in all the branches of learning.

analyzed: chub pa ni sems can rnams kyi de dag gi don thams cad sgrub par byed pa'i phyir ro //

original: rgyun chags pa ni rgyun ma chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyun chags pa ni rgyun ma chad pa'i phyir ro //

original: 'bel ba ni rnam pa sna tshogs su nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bel ba ni rnam pa sna tshogs su nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //

original: sgra thams cad rdzogs par byed pa ni /
analyzed: sgra thams cad rdzogs par byed pa ni /
translated: It satisfies all desires,

original: gsung gcig las sgra'i rnam par rig pa rnam pa du ma nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsung gcig las sgra'i rnam par rig pa rnam pa du ma nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: dbang po thams cad tshim par byed pa ni gcig las don du ma'i rnam par rig pa nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //

translated: It is not hurried, because it is not uttered in haste.

original: 'khor kun tu grags pa ni /

translated: because it is heard equally by those who are close and those who are far away.

analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa ni 'jig rten pa'i don thams cad dpe'i chos su sgyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is endowed with the most excellent of all aspects because all mundane goals are transformed into the qualities of the example.

original: yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: 'khor lo legs par sbyar ba yang 'phul bar byed pa dang / sa dang gnyis kyi yon tan gyis 'dril te /
analyzed: 'khor lo legs par sbyar ba yang 'phul bar byed pa dang / sa dang gnyis kyi yon tan gyis 'dril te /

original: gal te 'phul bar byed pas kyang legs par 'phul ba la /
analyzed: gal te 'phul bar byed pas kyang legs par 'phul ba la /
translated: If it is propelled, it is well-propelled.

original: gang du dbul bar bya ba'i sa yang mi mnyam pa med pa yin na'o //
analyzed: gang du dbul bar bya ba'i sa yang mi mnyam pa med pa yin na'o //
translated: And if the ground where it is to be propelled is without unevenness,

analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo legs par bshad pa yang ston pa po dang / nyan pa po dang / gnyis kyi yon tan gyis bskor te /
translated: in the same way, the Tathāgata’s well-spoken wheel of the Dharma is rolled by the qualities of the teacher, the hearer, and the two.

analyzed: gal te ston pa pos yang dag par ston pa gang la bstan par bya ba'i nyan pa po yang dag par nyan na'o //

analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi gang zag gnyis ni /
translated: that is why the Bhagavān said that two individuals are

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i rjes su skor bar byed pa yin te /
translated: He turns the wheel of the holy Dharma in the same way that the Tathagata did, after him.

original: gang zhig gus par chos 'chad pa dang / gang zhig de gus par nyan pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig gus par chos 'chad pa dang / gang zhig de gus par nyan pa'o //
translated: One teaches the Dharma with respect and the other listens to it with respect.

analyzed: chos dang ldan pa chos kyi 'khor lo zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig yin zhe na / don dam pa'i chos dang ma bral ba ni /
translated: What is the wheel of the holy Dharma?

original: chos dang ldan pa yin la kun rdzob kyi chos kyi ngo bo bstan pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'khor lo ni chos kyi 'khor lo yin no //
analyzed: chos dang ldan pa yin la kun rdzob kyi chos kyi ngo bo bstan pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'khor lo ni chos kyi 'khor lo yin no //
translated: The wheel of the Dharma is the wheel of the Dharma of the teaching of the nature of the conventional Dharma, which is not separate from the holy Dharma of ultimate reality.

original: gzhan @120b yang bstan pa yang chos zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan @120b yang bstan pa yang chos zhes bya ste /
translated: Moreover, the teaching is called the Dharma.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

analyzed: ji ltar na dge slong chos shes pa yang yin zhe na /
translated: How is a monk a knower of the Dharma?

original: 'di la dge slong chos shes pa ni 'di lta ste mdo sde dang / dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde dang zhes rgya cher gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di la dge slong chos shes pa ni 'di lta ste mdo sde dang / dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde dang zhes rgya cher gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: A monk who is a knower of the Dharma knows the sutras, the geya, etc.

original: rigs ba yang yin te /
analyzed: rigs ba yang yin te /
translated: It is also reasoning,

analyzed: ji skad du chos kyis chos tshol bar byed de /

analyzed: chos ma yin pas ma yin no zhes 'byung ba lta bu'o //
translated: not through the non-Dharma.

analyzed: de lta bas na rigs pa'i chos dang ma bral ba'i bstan pa ni chos kyi 'khor lo zhes pa yin no //
translated: ” Therefore, the teaching that is not divorced from the Dharma of reasoning is called the wheel of the Dharma.

original: 'khor lo dang chos mthun pas 'khor lo ste /
analyzed: 'khor lo dang chos mthun pas 'khor lo ste /
translated: It is a wheel because it is similar to a wheel.

original: 'dul ba'i rgyud gzhan dag la bskor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dul ba'i rgyud gzhan dag la bskor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is turned for the sake of disciplining other mind-streams.

original: gzhan mu stegs can dag la yang chos kyi 'khor lo yod mod kyi /
analyzed: gzhan mu stegs can dag la yang chos kyi 'khor lo yod mod kyi /
translated: The non-Buddhists also have a wheel of the Dharma,

analyzed: chos dang ldan pa ni ma yin te /
translated: but it is not the Dharma.

original: rigs pa'i chos dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs pa'i chos dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is divorced from the Dharma of reasoning.

analyzed: de lta bas na de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo kho na chos dang ldan pa zhes bya bar nges par gzung bar bya'o // de ltar bas na ji ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis chos kyi 'khor lo rjes su skor bar byed par 'gyur snyam nas /
translated: Therefore, only the wheel of the Dharma of the Tathāgata is to be ascertained as the Dharma.

original: gus par chos mnyan par bya'o //
analyzed: gus par chos mnyan par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should listen to the Dharma with respect, thinking, “How can I cause the wheel of the Dharma to turn, just as the Bhagavat Buddha did?”

original: 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bus /
analyzed: 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bus /
translated: The noble Shariputra said:

original: de ltar 'phags pa nyan thos chos yang dag par nyan na 'chad pa po la mtho mi 'tsham pa dang / gtam gyi bcud rtogs pa dang / chos nyid kyis ston pa la bsnyen bkur byed pa dang / bdag gi don rjes su 'thob pa dang /
analyzed: de ltar 'phags pa nyan thos chos yang dag par nyan na 'chad pa po la mtho mi 'tsham pa dang / gtam gyi bcud rtogs pa dang / chos nyid kyis ston pa la bsnyen bkur byed pa dang / bdag gi don rjes su 'thob pa dang /
translated: In that way, if the noble shravaka listens to the Dharma correctly, he will not disrespect the expounder, he will understand the essence of the teaching, he will serve the teacher with the Dharma, he will obtain his own aim🔽and he will also obtain nirvana.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa yang 'thob po zhes gsungs pa 'dis ci zhig bstan pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa yang 'thob po zhes gsungs pa 'dis ci zhig bstan pa yin zhe na /
translated: What does this passage teach?

original: chos yang dag par mnyan na dus gsum dag tu phan yon gsum yod par bstan pa yin te /🔽nyan pa'i dus na 'chad pa po'i bsam pa gang yin pa rdzogs par byed cing /

translated: It teaches that listening to the Dharma correctly has three benefits in the three times.🔽When you listen, you fulfill whatever wishes the expounder may have and you yourself obtain the essence of the meaning of the Dharma.

original: bdag nyid kyis kyang chos kyi don gyi bcud 'thob pas gzhan dang / bdag rjes su 'dzin pa dang / bsgrub pa'i dus su ston pa'i dgongs pa gang yin pa rdzogs par byed cing bdag nyid kyis kyang zag pa zad pas rjes su 'thob pas /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis kyang chos kyi don gyi bcud 'thob pas gzhan dang / bdag rjes su 'dzin pa dang / bsgrub pa'i dus su ston pa'i dgongs pa gang yin pa rdzogs par byed cing bdag nyid kyis kyang zag pa zad pas rjes su 'thob pas /
translated: Thus, you care for others and yourself. When you practice, you fulfill whatever wishes the teacher may have and you yourself obtain the Dharma by exhausting the defilements.

original: bdag dang gzhan rjes su 'dzin pa dang / tha ma'i dus su sdug bsngal thams cad kyi mthar phyin pa phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob bo //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan rjes su 'dzin pa dang / tha ma'i dus su sdug bsngal thams cad kyi mthar phyin pa phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob bo //
translated: and he obtains the nirvana without remainder, which is the end of all suffering.

original: gal te dus gsum dag tu yin na ci'i phyir nyan na zhes gsungs she na /
analyzed: gal te dus gsum dag tu yin na ci'i phyir nyan na zhes gsungs she na /
translated: If it is in the three times, why is it said, “When he hears”?

analyzed: /'on kyang nyan ba'i rgyu nyid la dgongs pa yin te /
translated: But the Buddha intends the cause of hearing.

original: dper na mar zos na brta par byed do zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na mar zos na brta par byed do zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, “By eating ghee, one becomes strong.”

original: de ltar na phan yon rnam pa lnga 'dod pas gus par chos mnyan par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na phan yon rnam pa lnga 'dod pas gus par chos mnyan par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one who desires the five benefits should listen to the Dharma with respect.

original: ji ltar long ba dang mig btsums pa la mar me sbar ba mtshungs pa ltar skal ba med pa lta ba log par zhugs pa dang / rna ba blags pa yang de lta bu yin pas /

translated: Just as a light is uselessly lit for a blind man or for one who sleeps with his eyes shut, so also is the Dharma for one who is unfortunate, who has entered the wrong path, or who is inattentive.

original: de lta bas na long ba dang 'dra bar gyur na mi rung ngo snyam nas gus par chos mnyan par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na long ba dang 'dra bar gyur na mi rung ngo snyam nas gus par chos mnyan par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, thinking “It would not be right for me to be like the blind man,” one should listen to the Dharma with respect.

original: brda mi phrad pas kyang sangs rgyas kyi gsung gus par mnyan par bya ste /
analyzed: brda mi phrad pas kyang sangs rgyas kyi gsung gus par mnyan par bya ste /
translated: One should listen to the Buddha’s word with respect even if one does not understand it.

original: 'di ltar dad pa tsam gyis kyang nyan na bsod nams chen po nyid dang ldan pa dang / shes rab kyis khams brtas par 'gyur na don rtogs pa la lta smos kyang ci dgos te /

translated: For, if one listens with mere faith, one will have great merit and one’s wisdom will grow, much less if one understands the meaning.

analyzed: ba lang rdzi dga' bos sbal ba khar bas man pa'i rtogs pa brjod pa yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The Avadana of Nanda the cowherd should be told here.

original: 'dir yang bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir yang bshad pa /
translated: And here it is told:

original: dad pas mnyan pas gang gis na//
analyzed: dad pas mnyan pas gang gis na//
translated: “By listening with faith,

analyzed: mtho ris dga' ba'i bsod nams dang // gang gis mya ngan 'das thob pa'i //
translated: The merit of the joys of the higher realms,

original: bdag cag gis ni dam ba'i chos kyi bcud kyis len blugs par bya ste /
analyzed: bdag cag gis ni dam ba'i chos kyi bcud kyis len blugs par bya ste /
translated: We will pour the elixir of the sublime Dharma.

original: khyed kyi bya ba ni sla ba yin /
analyzed: khyed kyi bya ba ni sla ba yin /
translated: Your task is easy.

original: nged kyi bya ba ni dka' ba yin no //
analyzed: nged kyi bya ba ni dka' ba yin no //
translated: Our task is difficult.

original: sla ba rigs pa dang ldan pa mi byed pa ni smad par bya ba yin pas de lta bas na gus par chos mnyan par bya'o //
analyzed: sla ba rigs pa dang ldan pa mi byed pa ni smad par bya ba yin pas de lta bas na gus par chos mnyan par bya'o //
translated: It is shameful not to do what is easy and reasonable. Therefore, you should listen to the Dharma with respect.

original: sangs rgyas kyi gsung 'di ni chu dang 'dra'o ;
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gsung 'di ni chu dang 'dra'o ;
translated: This speech of the Buddha is like water.

original: / chu ni phan pa rnam ba lnga byed de //
analyzed: / chu ni phan pa rnam ba lnga byed de //
translated: Water performs five kinds of benefit:

original: 'bras thug po che la sogs ba bangs par bya ba rnams bangs par byed pa dang / lus dang gos dang / snod dag gi dri ma sel ba dang / sos ka'i lus kyi yongs su gdung ba sel ba dang / skom dad che ba zhi bar byed pa dang /

analyzed: rtsva dang 'bru dang / nags tshal skyed cing 'phel bar byed pa yin no //

analyzed: de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi gsung la dad pa bskyed pas gdul bya'i rgyud bangs par byed pa dang / 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi dri ma sel ba dang / 'dod pa'i yongs su gdung ba sel ba dang / yang 'byung ba ba'i sred ba zhi bar byed pa dang /
translated: In the same way, the Buddha's speech causes the mind streams of those to be trained to grow by generating faith, it removes the stains of immorality, it removes the distress of desire, it allays the craving for rebirth,

analyzed: @121b byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i yon tan gyi rtsva dang / 'bru dang / nags tshal skyed cing 'phel bar byed pa yin no //
translated: and it causes the grass, grain and forest of the qualities of the factors of enlightenment to grow and increase.

original: phan pa rnam pa lnga po de yang dad pa rnyed pa dang / las dang bcas pa'i bslab ba gsum las brtsams par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: phan pa rnam pa lnga po de yang dad pa rnyed pa dang / las dang bcas pa'i bslab ba gsum las brtsams par rig par bya'o //
translated: These five benefits should be understood as beginning with the acquisition of faith and the three trainings together with their actions.

original: de lta bas na phan pa rnam pa lnga po de 'dod pas gus par sangs rgyas kyi gsung mnyan par bya'o /
analyzed: de lta bas na phan pa rnam pa lnga po de 'dod pas gus par sangs rgyas kyi gsung mnyan par bya'o /
translated: Therefore, those who desire these five benefits should listen to the Buddha’s teachings with respect.

original: mes bya ba bzhi byed de /

original: de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi gsung gi mes kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi gsung gi mes kyang /
translated: In the same way, the fire of the Buddha’s teachings

original: rgyud smin pa rnams la nyon mongs pa rnams sreg pa dang / rgyud ma smin pa rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams smin par byed pa dang / srid ba la mngon par dga' ba rnams skyo bar byed pa'i phyir gdung bar byed pa dang /
analyzed: rgyud smin pa rnams la nyon mongs pa rnams sreg pa dang / rgyud ma smin pa rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams smin par byed pa dang / srid ba la mngon par dga' ba rnams skyo bar byed pa'i phyir gdung bar byed pa dang /
translated: burns the afflictions of those whose mindstreams are ripe, it ripens the roots of virtue of those whose mindstreams are not ripe, it heats and dries up those who delight in cyclic existence, and it illuminates the Dharma.

original: skyo bar gyur ba rnams dang / the tshom zos pa dang / lam ngan par zhugs pa rnams la lam dang lam ma yin pa yang dag pa rab tu ston pa'i phyir gsal bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: skyo bar gyur ba rnams dang / the tshom zos pa dang / lam ngan par zhugs pa rnams la lam dang lam ma yin pa yang dag pa rab tu ston pa'i phyir gsal bar byed pa yin no //
translated: It is a light for those who are weary, for those who have doubts, and for those who have entered bad paths, because it shows them the path and what is not the path.

original: de lta bas na gus par chos mnyan par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na gus par chos mnyan par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should listen to the Dharma with respect.

original: gzhi lnga dag gis 'jug ngogs bde ba la brten par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhi lnga dag gis 'jug ngogs bde ba la brten par bya ste /
translated: One should rely on a pleasant riverbank for five reasons:

original: dri ma med par bya ba'i phyir dang / tsha ba rab tu zhi bar bya ba'i phyir dang / skom pa rab tu zhi bar bya ba'i phyir dang / dga' ba'i rtsed mo nyams su myong bar bya ba'i phyir dang / tshu rol gyi 'gram nas pha rol gyi 'gram du phyin par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dri ma med par bya ba'i phyir dang / tsha ba rab tu zhi bar bya ba'i phyir dang / skom pa rab tu zhi bar bya ba'i phyir dang / dga' ba'i rtsed mo nyams su myong bar bya ba'i phyir dang / tshu rol gyi 'gram nas pha rol gyi 'gram du phyin par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: in order to remove impurities, in order to cool off the heat, in order to quench thirst, in order to enjoy the pleasure of the water, and in order to cross from this shore to the other shore.

original: sangs rgyas kyi gsung 'jug ngogs bde ba la yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gsung 'jug ngogs bde ba la yang de bzhin te /
translated: The pleasant riverbank of the Buddha’s teaching is also like this.

original: 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi dri ma med par bya ba'i phyir dang / 'dod pa'i yongs su gdung ba rab tu zhi bar bya ba'i phyir dang / yang 'byung ba'i sred pa zhi bar bya ba'i phyir dang / bsam gtan dang / mngon par shes pa dang /
analyzed: 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi dri ma med par bya ba'i phyir dang / 'dod pa'i yongs su gdung ba rab tu zhi bar bya ba'i phyir dang / yang 'byung ba'i sred pa zhi bar bya ba'i phyir dang / bsam gtan dang / mngon par shes pa dang /
translated: In order to remove the stain of immorality, in order to pacify the torment of desire, in order to pacify craving for rebirth, in order to experience the play of the special qualities of the concentrations, the superknowledges,

original: tshad med pa dang / rnam par thar pa la sogs pa yon tan khyad par can gyi dga' ba'i rtsed mo nyams su myong bar bya ba'i phyir dang / tshu rol gyi 'gram 'jig tshogs nas pha rol gyi 'gram mya ngan las 'das par 'gro bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad med pa dang / rnam par thar pa la sogs pa yon tan khyad par can gyi dga' ba'i rtsed mo nyams su myong bar bya ba'i phyir dang / tshu rol gyi 'gram 'jig tshogs nas pha rol gyi 'gram mya ngan las 'das par 'gro bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: the immeasurables, the deliverances, etc., and in order to go from this shore of the aggregates to the other shore of nirvana.

original: de lta bas na 'jug ngogs bde ba la brten pa'i yon tan 'dod pa rnams kyis gus par sangs rgyas kyi gsung mnyan par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'jug ngogs bde ba la brten pa'i yon tan 'dod pa rnams kyis gus par sangs rgyas kyi gsung mnyan par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, those who desire the qualities of the happy life should respectfully listen to the teaching of the Buddha.

original: rgyu gsum dag gis ras la gzugs su mi bri ba 'grub ste /
analyzed: rgyu gsum dag gis ras la gzugs su mi bri ba 'grub ste /
translated: Three reasons are given why a picture should not be painted on cloth.

original: ras 'gul ba dang / dri ma can dang / thag thug nyid kyi skyon gyi phyir dang / tshon mi bzang @122a * //
analyzed: ras 'gul ba dang / dri ma can dang / thag thug nyid kyi skyon gyi phyir dang / tshon mi bzang @122a * //
translated: because of the faults of the canvas being torn, stained, and uneven, and because of the bad quality of the dye,

original: pa'i phyir dang / ri mo mkhan mi mkhas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa'i phyir dang / ri mo mkhan mi mkhas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and because of the painter’s lack of skill.

original: nyan pa po'i skye bo'i yid kyi ras la yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi gzugs su bri ba yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: nyan pa po'i skye bo'i yid kyi ras la yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi gzugs su bri ba yang de bzhin te /
translated: The canvas of the minds of the listeners is also like that, for the painting of the form of perfect pristine awareness.🔽Because of the faults of its being torn, stained, and uneven, due to distraction, obscuration, and previous obscuration, and because of the bad quality of the dye, the teaching of the badly explained Dharma,

original: rnam par g-yeng ba dang / sgrib pa dang / sngon gyi sgrib pas de g-yo ba dang / dri ma can dang / mi mnyam pa nyid kyi skyon gyi phyir dang / nyes par bshad pa'i chos kyi tshon mi bzang ba'i phyir dang / chos smra ba'i ri mo mkhan mi mkhas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba dang / sgrib pa dang / sngon gyi sgrib pas de g-yo ba dang / dri ma can dang / mi mnyam pa nyid kyi skyon gyi phyir dang / nyes par bshad pa'i chos kyi tshon mi bzang ba'i phyir dang / chos smra ba'i ri mo mkhan mi mkhas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and because of the painter’s lack of skill, the teacher of the Dharma.

original: de lta bas na tshon gyi skyon ni med de /
analyzed: de lta bas na tshon gyi skyon ni med de /
translated: Therefore, the fault is not in the dye.

original: chos ni legs par gsungs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos ni legs par gsungs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Dharma is well spoken.

original: khyed dang bdag cag la skyon 'byung ste ;
analyzed: khyed dang bdag cag la skyon 'byung ste ;
translated: The fault lies with you and us.

original: de yongs su spang ba'i phyir khyed kyis kyang gus par sangs rgyas kyi gsung mnyan par bya zhing /
analyzed: de yongs su spang ba'i phyir khyed kyis kyang gus par sangs rgyas kyi gsung mnyan par bya zhing /
translated: You should listen to the Buddha’s teachings with respect in order to completely abandon that.

original: bdag cag gis kyang gus par bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag cag gis kyang gus par bshad par bya'o //
translated: And we should explain them with respect.

original: dam pa'i chos mnyan pa la yon tan lnga yod de /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos mnyan pa la yon tan lnga yod de /
translated: There are five benefits to listening to the true Dharma:

original: rnam par mi shes pa rnam par shes par byed pa dang / nyes par bzung ba 'dor ba dang / the tshom zos pa nges par byed pa dang / nges par byas pa snying por byed pa dang / 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi mig sbyong bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi shes pa rnam par shes par byed pa dang / nyes par bzung ba 'dor ba dang / the tshom zos pa nges par byed pa dang / nges par byas pa snying por byed pa dang / 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi mig sbyong bar byed pa'o //
translated: it causes you to understand what you did not understand, it causes you to abandon what you have understood as faulty, it causes you to resolve your doubts, it causes you to make firm what you have resolved, and it causes you to purify the eye of noble wisdom.

original: de lta bas na gus par dam pa'i chos mnyan par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na gus par dam pa'i chos mnyan par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, you should listen to the true Dharma with respect.

original: long ba ni ston pa po'i yon tan gyi lam rnyed pa yang srid kyi /
analyzed: long ba ni ston pa po'i yon tan gyi lam rnyed pa yang srid kyi /
translated: It is possible that a blind person will find a path by following a teacher,

original: blun po ni log par lhung na ma yin no //
analyzed: blun po ni log par lhung na ma yin no //
translated: but a fool will not if he falls into error.

original: de lta bas na long ba ni bla'i /
analyzed: de lta bas na long ba ni bla'i /
translated: Therefore, it is better to be blind

original: blun po nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: blun po nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: than to be a fool.

original: blun po'i rgyu ni mi nyan pa yin no //
analyzed: blun po'i rgyu ni mi nyan pa yin no //
translated: The cause of being a fool is not listening.

original: de lta bas na /
analyzed: de lta bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: ji ltar na blun por mi 'gyur bar bya snyam nas /
analyzed: ji ltar na blun por mi 'gyur bar bya snyam nas /
translated: How can I avoid being stupid?

original: gus par chos mnyan par bya'o //
analyzed: gus par chos mnyan par bya'o //
translated: Listen to the Dharma with respect.

original: sems spre'u 'dra bar g-yo ba ni gnyis te /
analyzed: sems spre'u 'dra bar g-yo ba ni gnyis te /
translated: The mind is like a monkey, moving in two ways:

original: rnam par g-yeng ba dang / gnyid log pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba dang / gnyid log pa'o //
translated: distraction and sleep.

original: de char gcad pa'i phyir 'di skad ces gus par sangs rgyas kyi gsung mnyan par bya'o zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de char gcad pa'i phyir 'di skad ces gus par sangs rgyas kyi gsung mnyan par bya'o zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: In order to restrain it, it is said, “Listen to the Buddha’s teaching with respect.”

original: 'ga' zhig lam log par ni zhugs na yang //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig lam log par ni zhugs na yang //
translated: Even if someone has entered a wrong path,

original: rim gyis bsgrub pa byas na sman du 'gyur //
analyzed: rim gyis bsgrub pa byas na sman du 'gyur //
translated: if he practices gradually, he will become well.

original: dge dang mi dge gnyis ka dpyad byas na //
analyzed: dge dang mi dge gnyis ka dpyad byas na //
translated: Having examined both virtue and nonvirtue,

original: gang 'dod de nas rtog byed 'gro bar gyis //
analyzed: gang 'dod de nas rtog byed 'gro bar gyis //
translated: go to where you want to be.

original: 'ga' la 'khrul pa byung na bdag nyid ni //
analyzed: 'ga' la 'khrul pa byung na bdag nyid ni //
translated: If someone makes a mistake, knowing that

original: dag 'gyur 'di yin shes nas 'dod pa'ang srid //
analyzed: dag 'gyur 'di yin shes nas 'dod pa'ang srid //
translated: he will be purified, it is possible to desire.

original: yon tan de gsum brtags nas thub dbang gi / gsung ni gus par nyon ces brjod par bya //
analyzed: yon tan de gsum brtags nas thub dbang gi / gsung ni gus par nyon ces brjod par bya //
translated: Having examined those three qualities, it is said, “Listen to the speech of the Lord of Sages with respect.”

original: de @122b yang gang zag gsum po dag la dgongs nas gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de @122b yang gang zag gsum po dag la dgongs nas gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, it was taught with the intention of three kinds of persons:

original: gang zag gsum dag ni nges par legs pa la log par zhugs pa dang / bsgrub bar 'dod pa mngon par mi shes pa dang / bsgrub bar mi 'dod pa gcig tu bag med par gyur pa dri ma can gyi las can yin no ;
analyzed: gang zag gsum dag ni nges par legs pa la log par zhugs pa dang / bsgrub bar 'dod pa mngon par mi shes pa dang / bsgrub bar mi 'dod pa gcig tu bag med par gyur pa dri ma can gyi las can yin no ;
translated: The three persons are those who are definitely engaged in what is not good, those who desire to practice but do not understand, and those who do not desire to practice and are careless.

original: / nyi ma gnam la 'char ba na bya ba lnga byed de /
analyzed: / nyi ma gnam la 'char ba na bya ba lnga byed de /
translated: When the sun rises in the sky, it performs five actions:

original: mi la sogs pa dag gi lta ba skyed pa dang / 'ug pa la sogs pa dag gi lta ba zlog pa dang / 'brul sogs pa smin par bya ba smin par byed pa dang / 'dam la sogs pa bskam par bya ba skems pa dang /
analyzed: mi la sogs pa dag gi lta ba skyed pa dang / 'ug pa la sogs pa dag gi lta ba zlog pa dang / 'brul sogs pa smin par bya ba smin par byed pa dang / 'dam la sogs pa bskam par bya ba skems pa dang /
translated: it generates the vision of humans and so on, it stops the vision of owls and so on, it ripens what is to be ripened, such as crops, it dries up what is to be dried up, such as swamps,

original: lus dang chu la sogs pa dro bar bya ba dro bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: lus dang chu la sogs pa dro bar bya ba dro bar byed pa'o //
translated: and it warms the body and water and so on.

original: de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi gsung gi nyi mas kyang yang dag pa'i lta ba skyed pa dang / log par lta ba ldog pa dang / gdul ba'i zhing rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba'i 'bru la sogs pa smin par byed pa dang / sred pa'i 'dam skems par byed pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi gsung gi nyi mas kyang yang dag pa'i lta ba skyed pa dang / log par lta ba ldog pa dang / gdul ba'i zhing rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba'i 'bru la sogs pa smin par byed pa dang / sred pa'i 'dam skems par byed pa dang /
translated: Likewise, the sun of the Buddha's teaching generates the right view, stops wrong views, ripens the crops of the roots of virtue in the fields of disciples, dries up the swamp of craving,🔽and torments the demons by depriving them of their desires.

original: bdud rnams 'dod pas phongs par byed pa dang / gdul bya bag med ba rnams skyo bar byed pas gdung bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: bdud rnams 'dod pas phongs par byed pa dang / gdul bya bag med ba rnams skyo bar byed pas gdung bar byed pa yin no //
translated: It torments the careless disciples by making them feel remorse.

original: de lta bas na gus par sangs rgyas kyi gsung mnyan par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na gus par sangs rgyas kyi gsung mnyan par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, you should listen to the Buddha's teaching with respect.

original: rdo thal gyi rdo mes bsregs pa chus 'jig par byed pa dang 'dra bar nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal gyi rdo shes rab kyi mes yongs su bsregs pa ting nge 'dzin gyi chus spangs nas 'jig go //
analyzed: rdo thal gyi rdo mes bsregs pa chus 'jig par byed pa dang 'dra bar nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal gyi rdo shes rab kyi mes yongs su bsregs pa ting nge 'dzin gyi chus spangs nas 'jig go //
translated: Just as a stone of limestone is destroyed by water after it has been heated by fire, so the latent states of the afflictions are destroyed by the water of meditative concentration after they have been thoroughly heated by the fire of wisdom.

original: shes rab de yang dam pa'i chos mnyan pa med par ni ma yin pas /
analyzed: shes rab de yang dam pa'i chos mnyan pa med par ni ma yin pas /
translated: And that wisdom does not exist without listening to the holy Dharma.

original: de lta bas na gus par chos mnyan par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na gus par chos mnyan par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should listen to the Dharma with devotion.

original: tshig gi khur thogs kyang don mngon par mi shes na /
analyzed: tshig gi khur thogs kyang don mngon par mi shes na /
translated: If one does not understand the meaning of the words, even if one carries a heavy load of them,

original: de'i don mi 'thob ste /
analyzed: de'i don mi 'thob ste /
translated: one will not attain the goal.

original: khye'u'i mgul du gter gyi kha chems kyi yi ge btags pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: khye'u'i mgul du gter gyi kha chems kyi yi ge btags pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: It is like a boy to whom a letter containing a treasure was tied around his neck.

original: de lta bas na mang du thos pas kyang don shes pa nyid du bya ba'i phyir mdo sde'i don mnyan pa la 'bad pa dang ldan par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na mang du thos pas kyang don shes pa nyid du bya ba'i phyir mdo sde'i don mnyan pa la 'bad pa dang ldan par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, even if one has heard much, one should strive to listen to the meaning of the sūtras in order to understand the meaning.

original: mel tshe ba so sor mi rtog pa ni ma nyal zhes zer ba bzhin du chom po rnams kyis bcom mo //
analyzed: mel tshe ba so sor mi rtog pa ni ma nyal zhes zer ba bzhin du chom po rnams kyis bcom mo //
translated: The watchmen who do not examine are said to be asleep, and the thieves destroy them.

original: de bzhin du sgra tsam la brtson pa'i mang du thos pa so sor mi rtog ba yang nyon mongs pa'i dgra rnams kyis 'joms so //
analyzed: de bzhin du sgra tsam la brtson pa'i mang du thos pa so sor mi rtog ba yang nyon mongs pa'i dgra rnams kyis 'joms so //
translated: In the same way, the thieves of the afflictions destroy the one who has heard much, who is devoted to mere words and does not examine.

original: so sor rtog pa de yang don shes pa nyid med na med pas de lta bas na don gzung pa la 'bad pa dang ldan par bya'o //
analyzed: so sor rtog pa de yang don shes pa nyid med na med pas de lta bas na don gzung pa la 'bad pa dang ldan par bya'o //
translated: And that examination does not exist without understanding the meaning. Therefore, one should strive to grasp the meaning.

original: de bzhin du @123a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du @123a * //
translated: In the same way,

original: rol mo mkhan rkun pos 'jigs nas mi nyal bar bya ba'i phyir glu len bzhin du bcom mo zhes bya ba yang dper brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rol mo mkhan rkun pos 'jigs nas mi nyal bar bya ba'i phyir glu len bzhin du bcom mo zhes bya ba yang dper brjod par bya'o //
translated: The example of the musician who, out of fear of thieves, did not sleep but sang and was killed should be mentioned here.

original: ji ltar long ba me mar 'dzin pa ni gzhan dag la phan par 'gyur ba dang 'dra bar don mngon par mi shes pa'i thos pa 'dzin pa yang de lta bu yin pas de lta bas na don shes pa nyid du bya ba'i phyir don mnyan pa la🔽'bad par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar long ba me mar 'dzin pa ni gzhan dag la phan par 'gyur ba dang 'dra bar don mngon par mi shes pa'i thos pa 'dzin pa yang de lta bu yin pas de lta bas na don shes pa nyid du bya ba'i phyir don mnyan pa la 'bad par bya'o //
translated: Just as the blind man holding a lamp benefits others, so also is the holding of the scriptures by one who does not understand the meaning. Therefore, in order to understand the meaning, one should strive to listen to the scriptures.

original: sangs rgyas kyi gsung bstan bcos kyi mtshan nyid du 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gsung bstan bcos kyi mtshan nyid du 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the Buddha's teachings are suitable as the characteristics of treatises.

original: nges pa'i tshig tu 'chos pa dang / skyob par byed pas /
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig tu 'chos pa dang / skyob par byed pas /
translated: In etymology, it is a treatise because it corrects and protects.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos so //
translated: Therefore, it is a treatise.

original: nyon mongs dgra rnams ma lus 'chos pa dang // ngan 'gro srid las skyob pa gang yin te //
analyzed: nyon mongs dgra rnams ma lus 'chos pa dang // ngan 'gro srid las skyob pa gang yin te //
translated: That which corrects all afflictive enemies and protects from the existence of bad rebirths,

original: 'chos skyob yon tan phyir na bstan bcos te //
analyzed: 'chos skyob yon tan phyir na bstan bcos te //
translated: because of the qualities of correcting and protecting, is a treatise.

original: gnyis po 'di dag gzhan gyi lugs la med //
analyzed: gnyis po 'di dag gzhan gyi lugs la med //
translated: These two do not exist in other systems.

original: de lta bas na sangs rgyas kyi gsung kho na don dam par bstan bcos yin pas 'chos pa dang skyob pa'i yon tan gyi phyir yang don gzung pa la 'bad pa dang ldan par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na sangs rgyas kyi gsung kho na don dam par bstan bcos yin pas 'chos pa dang skyob pa'i yon tan gyi phyir yang don gzung pa la 'bad pa dang ldan par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, since the Buddha's Word alone is the ultimate treatise, one should strive to grasp its meaning because it has the qualities of correcting and protecting.

original: legs par ston pa la brten na phan yon lnga yod de /
analyzed: legs par ston pa la brten na phan yon lnga yod de /
translated: There are five benefits in relying on a good teacher:

original: lam ngan pa yongs su spong ba dang / lam bzang po la yang dag par gnas par byed pa dang // 'brog dgon pa las rgal ba'i dbugs 'byin pa dang / bde bar 'gro ba dang / 'dod pa'i yul du yang dag par phyin par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: lam ngan pa yongs su spong ba dang / lam bzang po la yang dag par gnas par byed pa dang // 'brog dgon pa las rgal ba'i dbugs 'byin pa dang / bde bar 'gro ba dang / 'dod pa'i yul du yang dag par phyin par byed pa yin no //
translated: one abandons the bad path, one is caused to enter the good path, one is comforted in crossing the wilderness, one goes in comfort, and one is caused to arrive at the desired place.

original: de bzhin du dam pa'i chos ston pa la brten na log par lta ba la sogs pa lam ngan pa yongs su spong ba dang / yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa lam bzang po la yang dag par gnas par byed pa dang / 'khor ba'i 'brog dgon pa las rgal ba'i dbugs 'byin pa dang ngan song las mchongs te bde bar 'gro ba dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du dam pa'i chos ston pa la brten na log par lta ba la sogs pa lam ngan pa yongs su spong ba dang / yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa lam bzang po la yang dag par gnas par byed pa dang / 'khor ba'i 'brog dgon pa las rgal ba'i dbugs 'byin pa dang ngan song las mchongs te bde bar 'gro ba dang /
translated: Likewise, if one relies on the teaching of the holy Dharma, one will completely abandon bad paths such as wrong views, one will abide in good paths such as right views, one will be relieved from the wilderness of cyclic existence, one will leap over the lower realms and go to the happy realms,

original: 'dod pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i yul du yang dag par phyin par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i yul du yang dag par phyin par byed pa yin no //
translated: and one will be led to the place of nirvana that one desires.

original: de dag kyang mnyan pa las 'byung ba'i /
analyzed: de dag kyang mnyan pa las 'byung ba'i /
translated: Since these benefits arise from listening,

original: ma mnyan pa las ma yin pas gus bar mnyan par bya'o //
analyzed: ma mnyan pa las ma yin pas gus bar mnyan par bya'o //
translated: they do not arise from not listening, so one should listen respectfully.

original: rgyu bsags pa rnams ni cung zad mnyan pas bsod nams chen po dang ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyu bsags pa rnams ni cung zad mnyan pas bsod nams chen po dang ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: Those who have accumulated the causes for listening will obtain great merit from listening a little.🔽For example, when Shariputra was giving instructions on full ordination, a Brahmin heard them, hid himself,

original: dper na 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bus bsnyen par rdzogs par bya ba la rjes su bstan pa bram ze zhig gis thos nas gab ste 'dug nas /
analyzed: dper na 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bus bsnyen par rdzogs par bya ba la rjes su bstan pa bram ze zhig gis thos nas gab ste 'dug nas /
translated: and took full ordination.

original: rab tu byung ba @123b dang tshul khrims nyams pa la sdug bsngal rnam pa bcu gnyis 'byung ngo zhes thos nas /
analyzed: rab tu byung ba @123b dang tshul khrims nyams pa la sdug bsngal rnam pa bcu gnyis 'byung ngo zhes thos nas /

analyzed: 'chal pa'i tshul khrims bya ba la mngon du phyogs pa las log ba lta bu'o //

original: sdug bsngal rnam pa bcu gnyis ni /
analyzed: sdug bsngal rnam pa bcu gnyis ni /

original: nyon mongs pas yongs su gdungs pa'i sdug bsngal dang / kun du tshol ba'i sdug bsngal dang / gnod pa'i sdug bsngal dang / 'dod pas phongs pa'i sdug bsngal dang / dogs pa'i sdug bsngal dang / gleng ba'i sdug bsngal dang / kun du spong ba'i sdug bsngal dang /

translated: the suffering of not being honored, the suffering of being despised, the suffering of regret, the suffering of the maturation of karma in the lower realms in the next life, and the suffering of the natural result of difficulty in practicing pure conduct, because of the abundance of afflictions.

original: 'bab par 'dod pa yang da nur me rab tu 'bab pa'i bu gar sbal pa 'jug par mngon par phyogs pa ltos shig / khyod me rab tu 'bar bar 'jug par 'dod dam zhes spyo ba thos nas log pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bab par 'dod pa yang da nur me rab tu 'bab pa'i bu gar sbal pa 'jug par mngon par phyogs pa ltos shig / khyod me rab tu 'bar bar 'jug par 'dod dam zhes spyo ba thos nas log pa yin no //
translated: He heard the scolding, Look, one who desires to fall is like a turtle who wants to enter the opening of a burning stick. He turned back, thinking, Do you want to enter a burning fire?

original: chos dga' chu srin du gyur pa na /
analyzed: chos dga' chu srin du gyur pa na /
translated: When Dharmarata was a crocodile,

original: sangs rgyas kyi sgra tsam zhig thos pa las sngon phyag 'tshal ba tsam la goms pa'i phyir kha btsums te 'dug pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sgra tsam zhig thos pa las sngon phyag 'tshal ba tsam la goms pa'i phyir kha btsums te 'dug pa yin no //
translated: he heard just the sound of the Buddha. Because of his previous habit of just bowing down, he remained silent.

original: de lta bas na cung zad cig thos bas kyang rgyu bsags pa rnams kyis dge ba rab tu rgyas pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi gsung mnyan pa la 'bad pa dang ldan par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na cung zad cig thos bas kyang rgyu bsags pa rnams kyis dge ba rab tu rgyas pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi gsung mnyan pa la 'bad pa dang ldan par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, those who have accumulated the causes by listening a little should strive to listen to the Buddha's teachings in order to greatly increase their virtue.

analyzed: byad stems mkhan gyis bong bur byas pa'i mis de shes pa'i bud med kyi ngag mnyan nas /
translated: A man made into a donkey by a sorcerer listened to the words of a woman who knew the spell,

analyzed: de'i sman 'dod pas ldam ldum thams cad zos pa dang / rdul 'khru ba rnams kyis gser gyi phyir 'byung khungs thams cad spyod bar byed do //
translated: and by desiring the medicine for that, he ate all the castor beans, and the miners worked all the mines for gold.

original: de bzhin du bdag nyid thar ba'i chos 'dod bas /
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag nyid thar ba'i chos 'dod bas /
translated: In the same way, one who desires the Dharma of liberation

analyzed: chos gang thar par 'gyur ba la chos de ni dam pa'i chos thams cad mnyan pa las 'byung ngo snyam nas mnyan par bya'o //
translated: should think, The Dharma that leads to liberation arises from listening to all the holy Dharma, and should listen.🔽Suffering, pervasiveness,🔽permanence, lack of means,

original: sdug bsngal myong dang khyab pa dang // rtag pa dang ni thabs med dang // gnod pa mang dang 'joms byed pa'i //
analyzed: sdug bsngal myong dang khyab pa dang // rtag pa dang ni thabs med dang // gnod pa mang dang 'joms byed pa'i //
translated: many harms, and destroyer,

original: lus dang 'dra ba'i nad med do //
analyzed: lus dang 'dra ba'i nad med do //
translated: like the body, are not diseases.

original: 'dis ni lus kyi nad 'di la skyon drug po @124a * //
analyzed: 'dis ni lus kyi nad 'di la skyon drug po @124a * //
translated: This shows that this illness of the body has six faults:

original: na ba dang 'brel ba nyid dang / lus thams cad la khyab ba nyid dang / bar chad med par 'jug pa nyid dang / gsor mi rung ba nyid dang / gnod ba mang ba nyid dang / srog 'phrog ba nyid yod par yongs su bstan to //🔽sman pa'i phul gyis nad 'di dag /
analyzed: na ba dang 'brel ba nyid dang / lus thams cad la khyab ba nyid dang / bar chad med par 'jug pa nyid dang / gsor mi rung ba nyid dang / gnod ba mang ba nyid dang / srog 'phrog ba nyid yod par yongs su bstan to // sman pa'i phul gyis nad 'di dag /
translated: it is related to sickness, it pervades the whole body, it operates without interruption, it is incurable, it has many harmful effects, and it robs one of life.🔽The best of physicians has said

analyzed: gtan du 'byin par byed pa yi //
translated: that this illness is to be cured

original: sman ni yan lag brgyad ldan pa //

original: 'di ni lhag pa'i rnyed ba ste //
analyzed: 'di ni lhag pa'i rnyed ba ste //
translated: This is a special discovery

original: rin med par yang rnyed ba yin //🔽bdag nyid 'bad ba med par ni //
analyzed: rin med par yang rnyed ba yin // bdag nyid 'bad ba med par ni //
translated: that can be found without price.🔽But it cannot be accomplished

original: nam yang bsgrub par mi nus so //🔽ji ltar skyen rnams ma bsal na //
analyzed: nam yang bsgrub par mi nus so // ji ltar skyen rnams ma bsal na //
translated: without effort on one’s own part.🔽Just as a medicinal elixir cannot be produced

analyzed: bcud kyis len ni mi 'grub bzhin // de bzhin rnam par ma zhi ba'i //
translated: without removing the impurities,🔽so the path does not remain

original: sems la lam ni mi gnas so //
analyzed: sems la lam ni mi gnas so //
translated: in an undisciplined mind.

analyzed: de yang rin med par dam pa'i chos mnyan pa las rnyed kyi gzhan las ni ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, one acquires it by listening to the Good Law without any material interest, not by any other means.

original: de lta bas na gus par sangs rgyas kyi gsung mnyan par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na gus par sangs rgyas kyi gsung mnyan par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should listen to the word of the Buddha with respect.

original: rgyu gsum dag gis phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams mnyan pa'i dngos por 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyu gsum dag gis phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams mnyan pa'i dngos por 'gyur te /
translated: For three reasons, external things are the object of listening:

original: spangs pas ni bong ba dang pags pa skam po la sogs pa dag go //
analyzed: spangs pas ni bong ba dang pags pa skam po la sogs pa dag go //
translated: 1. by rejection: clods of earth, dry skins, etc.

analyzed: tsha bar bya bas ni lcags dang zangs la sogs pa dag go //
translated: 2. by heating: iron, copper, etc.

original: brdung bas ni rtsva mun dza dang bal ba dza la sogs pa dag go //
analyzed: brdung bas ni rtsva mun dza dang bal ba dza la sogs pa dag go //
translated: 3. by beating: muñja grass, cotton, etc.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: In the same way,

original: sdang dang bag med rmongs rnams ni //
analyzed: sdang dang bag med rmongs rnams ni //
translated: those who are hostile, careless, or confused,

original: dad dang skyo dang rtogs pa ste //
analyzed: dad dang skyo dang rtogs pa ste //
translated: those who have faith, who are disgusted, or who understand,

original: mnyan pa'i dngos po'i rgyu gsum du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mnyan pa'i dngos po'i rgyu gsum du 'gyur ro //
translated: are the three causes of the object of listening.

original: de yang gang las 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang las 'byung zhe na /
translated: From what does this object of listening arise?🔽From the meaning of the qualities and the faults,

original: skal ldan rnams kyis mnyan byas na //🔽yon tan skyon don nges las 'byung //
analyzed: skal ldan rnams kyis mnyan byas na // yon tan skyon don nges las 'byung //
translated: when the fortunate listen to it.

original: gang gis yon tan nam gang gi skyon thos pas she na /
analyzed: gang gis yon tan nam gang gi skyon thos pas she na /
translated: From what does the meaning of the qualities and the faults arise?

original: dkon mchog gsum gyi yon tan te //🔽skyon ni sdig 'dod srid rten can //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum gyi yon tan te // skyon ni sdig 'dod srid rten can //
translated: The qualities of the Three Jewels🔽are the absence of faults, the desire to benefit, and the desire to act.🔽The faults are the desire for sin, the desire for existence, and the desire for renown.

original: de sdig pa dang 'dod pa rnams dang srid pa'i yin no //
analyzed: de sdig pa dang 'dod pa rnams dang srid pa'i yin no //
translated: The absence of faults is the absence of the desire for sin, the desire for existence, and the desire for renown.

original: don gang gis nges pa thob pas she na /
analyzed: don gang gis nges pa thob pas she na /
translated: By what meaning is certainty obtained?🔽The connection is the certainty of the two characteristics,

original: mtshan nyid rnam gnyis de rgyu dang // 'bras bur nges pa 'brel pa yin //
analyzed: mtshan nyid rnam gnyis de rgyu dang // 'bras bur nges pa 'brel pa yin //
translated: the cause and the effect.
