analyzed: mtshan nyid rnam pa gnyis ni phung po la sogs pa dag gi rang gi mtshan nyid dang spyi'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The two kinds of characteristics are the specific characteristics and the general characteristics of the aggregates, etc.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel ba'i mtshan nyid ni ma rig pa dang 'du byed la sogs pa dag gi dang / sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba la sogs pa dag gi'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel ba'i mtshan nyid ni ma rig pa dang 'du byed la sogs pa dag gi dang / sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba la sogs pa dag gi'o //
translated: The characteristics of the connection of cause and effect are those of ignorance, the formative forces, etc., and of suffering, origination, etc.

original: de lta bas na yon tan 'di dag @124b ni dam pa'i chos mnyan na yod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na yon tan 'di dag @124b ni dam pa'i chos mnyan na yod par rig par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, these qualities should be known as existing in the listening to the true Dharma.

original: de la gus par bya'o //
analyzed: de la gus par bya'o //
translated: One should have respect for that.

original: nyan pa'i skye bo dag ni phal cher phyir phyogs dang // yongs su 'dzin par byed pa phal cher 'das pa dang // nyes par rnam par bshad pa dag gis mthu bcom pas //
analyzed: nyan pa'i skye bo dag ni phal cher phyir phyogs dang // yongs su 'dzin par byed pa phal cher 'das pa dang // nyes par rnam par bshad pa dag gis mthu bcom pas //
translated: Most of the listeners are turned away, and most of the supporters have passed away, and the power of the teaching is destroyed by the bad explanations.

original: deng sang legs par bshad ba mthar gyur to //
analyzed: deng sang legs par bshad ba mthar gyur to //
translated: The good explanations have disappeared.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ni deng sang phyogs gnyis la sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa yongs su nyams pa rnam pa bzhi dang / nub la thug pa nyid du ston pa yin no //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ni deng sang phyogs gnyis la sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa yongs su nyams pa rnam pa bzhi dang / nub la thug pa nyid du ston pa yin no //
translated: This verse shows that the teaching of the Buddha is now in its fourth and final stage of degeneration, in both the monastic and lay communities.

original: nyan pa'i skye bo dag ni phal cher phyir phyogs dang // zhes bya bas ni khyim pa'i phyogs la nyan pa yongs su nyams par ston pa yin te /
analyzed: nyan pa'i skye bo dag ni phal cher phyir phyogs dang // zhes bya bas ni khyim pa'i phyogs la nyan pa yongs su nyams par ston pa yin te /
translated: Most of the listeners are turned away. This shows the degeneration of the listeners in the lay community.

original: de dag ni phal cher nyan pa po yin pas so //
analyzed: de dag ni phal cher nyan pa po yin pas so //
translated: They are mostly listeners.

original: yongs su 'dzin par byed pa phal cher 'das pa dang // zhes bya bas ni rab tu byung ba'i phyogs la 'don pa yongs su nyams par ston pa yin te /
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin par byed pa phal cher 'das pa dang // zhes bya bas ni rab tu byung ba'i phyogs la 'don pa yongs su nyams par ston pa yin te /
translated: Most of the supporters have passed away. This shows the degeneration of the reciters in the monastic community.

original: de dag ni phal cher yongs su 'dzin par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni phal cher yongs su 'dzin par byed pa yin te /
translated: They are mostly those who hold the scriptures,

original: thos pa 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thos pa 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they hold the scriptures.🔽Those who explain incorrectly

original: nyes par rnam par bshad pa dag gis zhes bya bas ni de nyid la don bshad pa yongs su nyams par ston pa yin te /
analyzed: nyes par rnam par bshad pa dag gis zhes bya bas ni de nyid la don bshad pa yongs su nyams par ston pa yin te /
translated: show the degeneration of the meaning of the scriptures,

original: don log bar 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don log bar 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they explain the meaning incorrectly.🔽Those who have destroyed their power

original: mthu bcom pas zhes bya bas ni rtogs pa nyams par ston pa yin te /
analyzed: mthu bcom pas zhes bya bas ni rtogs pa nyams par ston pa yin te /
translated: show the degeneration of realization,🔽because they do not make the scriptures effective

original: gang gi don du ste /
analyzed: gang gi don du ste /
translated: for the purpose for which they were taught.

original: dge slong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu rtogs pa'i don du bshad pa ste /🔽de nus par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //🔽'di ni mdor bsdus nas yongs su nyams pa rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te /
analyzed: dge slong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu rtogs pa'i don du bshad pa ste / de nus par mi byed pa'i phyir ro // 'di ni mdor bsdus nas yongs su nyams pa rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te /
translated: The scriptures were taught for the purpose of realizing the fruit of the life of a monk.🔽In brief, degeneration is twofold:

original: tshig dang don gnyis kyi lung yongs su nyams pa dang / rtogs pa yongs su nyams pa'o ;
analyzed: tshig dang don gnyis kyi lung yongs su nyams pa dang / rtogs pa yongs su nyams pa'o ;
translated: degeneration of the scriptures through the degeneration of both the words and the meaning, and degeneration of realization.

original: / gzhan yang nyan pa'i skye bo phyir phyogs pa nyid dang / yongs su 'dzin par byed pa phal cher 'das pa nyid kyis ni thos pa yongs su nyams pa yin la /
analyzed: / gzhan yang nyan pa'i skye bo phyir phyogs pa nyid dang / yongs su 'dzin par byed pa phal cher 'das pa nyid kyis ni thos pa yongs su nyams pa yin la /
translated: Moreover, the degeneration of hearing is due to the fact that the audience is turned away and the teacher is mostly deceased.

original: nyes par bshad pa nyid kyis ni yang dag par bsam pa yongs su nyams pa yin no //
analyzed: nyes par bshad pa nyid kyis ni yang dag par bsam pa yongs su nyams pa yin no //
translated: The degeneration of proper reflection is due to the fact that the teaching is badly explained.

original: mthu bcom pa nyid kyis ni yang dag par bsgom pa yongs su nyams pa yin no //
analyzed: mthu bcom pa nyid kyis ni yang dag par bsgom pa yongs su nyams pa yin no //
translated: The degeneration of proper meditative concentration is due to the fact that the power of meditative concentration is destroyed.

original: deng sang legs par bshad pa mthar gyur to //
analyzed: deng sang legs par bshad pa mthar gyur to //
translated: The teaching has come to an end, well explained.

original: zhes bya ba ni nub la thug pa nyid du ston pa yin no //🔽de ltar sangs rgyas kyi gsung ni yongs su nyams ba dang yun ring du mi gnas par rig par byas nas ji srid du cung zad lus pa @125a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni nub la thug pa nyid du ston pa yin no // de ltar sangs rgyas kyi gsung ni yongs su nyams ba dang yun ring du mi gnas par rig par byas nas ji srid du cung zad lus pa @125a * //
translated: This shows that the end of the teaching is near.

original: de srid du 'di mnyan pa dang gzung ba dang don mthun par bsgrub pa la dad pa can rnams kyis rab tu 'bad par bya'o //
analyzed: de srid du 'di mnyan pa dang gzung ba dang don mthun par bsgrub pa la dad pa can rnams kyis rab tu 'bad par bya'o //
translated: Thus, knowing that the teaching of the Buddha has degenerated and will not last long, the faithful should make an effort to hear it, to retain it, and to practice it in accordance with the teaching, for as long as it remains.

original: deng sang thub pa'i gsung ni smra bar byed pa'ang nyung //
analyzed: deng sang thub pa'i gsung ni smra bar byed pa'ang nyung //
translated: Nowadays, those who speak the Sage’s words are few.

original: dngul dang gser du 'byed par 'gyur ba'ang nyung bar gyur //
analyzed: dngul dang gser du 'byed par 'gyur ba'ang nyung bar gyur //
translated: Those who distinguish silver and gold are also few.

original: de ltar lung dang rtogs pa dag la 'bad zhan pas //
analyzed: de ltar lung dang rtogs pa dag la 'bad zhan pas //
translated: Thus, due to weak effort in scripture and realization,

original: sangs rgyas nyi ma mthar phyin dri ma med 'di nub //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyi ma mthar phyin dri ma med 'di nub //
translated: The sun of the Buddha, perfect and stainless, has set.

original: de lta bas na ji srid thams cad ma nub pa //
analyzed: de lta bas na ji srid thams cad ma nub pa //
translated: Therefore, for as long as all [the teachings] have not set,

original: de srid ji bzhin don rnams dbye la 'bad par gyis //
analyzed: de srid ji bzhin don rnams dbye la 'bad par gyis //
translated: Strive to discern the meaning as it is.

original: thub pa'i gsung gi snang ba nub par gyur na ni //
analyzed: thub pa'i gsung gi snang ba nub par gyur na ni //
translated: When the light of the Sage’s words has set,

original: 'gro ba kun du mun pa gcig pu'i thibs por 'gyur //
analyzed: 'gro ba kun du mun pa gcig pu'i thibs por 'gyur //
translated: The entire world will be enveloped in a single darkness.

original: de lta bas na ji srid du mun pa gcig pu'i thibs po mi 'byung ba de srid du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin gyi don rab tu rnam par dbye ba'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi gsung mnyan pa la dad pa can rnams kyis shin tu rigs par
analyzed: de lta bas na ji srid du mun pa gcig pu'i thibs po mi 'byung ba de srid du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin gyi don rab tu rnam par dbye ba'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi gsung mnyan pa la dad pa can rnams kyis shin tu rigs par
translated: Therefore, for as long as that single darkness does not arise, those who have faith in listening to the Buddha’s words in order to discern the meaning as it truly is should,

original: bya'o // ston pa'i zhal nas byung ba skye ba'i mig gi rab rib zhi bar mdzad pa bkra shis kyi //
analyzed: bya'o // ston pa'i zhal nas byung ba skye ba'i mig gi rab rib zhi bar mdzad pa bkra shis kyi //
translated: The Teacher has said: “Place in your mind the nectar of the ear, which is the source of good fortune, for it pacifies the eye disease of birth.

original: 'byung gnas sems la zhog shig gang phyir 'di ni lus can rnams kyi rna ba'i bdud rtsi dang // nyon mongs pa yi dug kun sel bar mdzad pa yin pas don yang dag par bsam par gyis //
analyzed: 'byung gnas sems la zhog shig gang phyir 'di ni lus can rnams kyi rna ba'i bdud rtsi dang // nyon mongs pa yi dug kun sel bar mdzad pa yin pas don yang dag par bsam par gyis //
translated: Since it is the nectar of the ear for embodied beings and it removes all the poisons of the afflictions, you should contemplate its meaning.

original: rgyu 'di rnams kyis rtag tu gus par sangs rgyas kyi ni gsung dag mnyan par bya ba'i rigs //
analyzed: rgyu 'di rnams kyis rtag tu gus par sangs rgyas kyi ni gsung dag mnyan par bya ba'i rigs //

original: rgyu gang gis she na /
analyzed: rgyu gang gis she na /

translated: Since it is the nectar of the ear for embodied beings and it removes all the poisons of the afflictions, you should contemplate its meaning.

original: gang gi phyir 'di don bzang po nyid kyis nyon mongs pa'i dug thams cad sel bar mdzad pa'i don gyis te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di don bzang po nyid kyis nyon mongs pa'i dug thams cad sel bar mdzad pa'i don gyis te /
translated: Because it is good in meaning, it is good in sound, since it is the antidote to all the poisons of the afflictions.

original: rgyu 'di rnams kyis so //
analyzed: rgyu 'di rnams kyis so //
translated: For these reasons, it is good in sound.

original: de ltar na gsung ba po dang / gsung dang don phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na gsung ba po dang / gsung dang don phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the teacher, the teaching and the meaning are all excellent.

original: sangs rgyas kyi gsung 'di ni mnyan na sim par byed pa dang / bsams na rtogs par byed pa dang / rtogs na grol bar byed pa dang / brjod na bzang ba dang / 'phags pa'i nor bdun sgrub pa'i phyir nor dang ldan pa dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gsung 'di ni mnyan na sim par byed pa dang / bsams na rtogs par byed pa dang / rtogs na grol bar byed pa dang / brjod na bzang ba dang / 'phags pa'i nor bdun sgrub pa'i phyir nor dang ldan pa dang /
translated: The Buddha's speech is pleasing to hear, it is to be contemplated, it is liberating to realize, it is good to express, it is endowed with wealth because it establishes the seven riches of the aryas,

original: skyon bdun 'khru ba'i phyir bsod nams dang / yon tan thams cad kyi sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir bkra @125b shis pa nyid dang / gtan gyi tshangs par spyod pa'i dbang du mdzad pa'i phyir tshe la phan pa dang / rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa dang /
analyzed: skyon bdun 'khru ba'i phyir bsod nams dang / yon tan thams cad kyi sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir bkra @125b shis pa nyid dang / gtan gyi tshangs par spyod pa'i dbang du mdzad pa'i phyir tshe la phan pa dang / rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa dang /
translated: it is meritorious because it purifies the seven faults, it is auspicious because it precedes all good qualities, it is beneficial for life because it is the domain of eternal pure conduct, it is naturally pure,

original: dgongs pa 'jam ba dang / don dang mthun pa dang / 'dul ba dang mthun ba dang / dus la bab ba dang / ran bar bshad pa dang / bsod nams 'dren pa dang / ye shes 'dren ba dang / dga' ba 'dren pa dang /
analyzed: dgongs pa 'jam ba dang / don dang mthun pa dang / 'dul ba dang mthun ba dang / dus la bab ba dang / ran bar bshad pa dang / bsod nams 'dren pa dang / ye shes 'dren ba dang / dga' ba 'dren pa dang /
translated: leads to joy,🔽removes fear,🔽removes sorrow,

original: skrag pa sel ba dang / mya ngan sel ba dang / nyon mongs pa sel ba ste /
analyzed: skrag pa sel ba dang / mya ngan sel ba dang / nyon mongs pa sel ba ste /
translated: and removes the afflictions.

original: mdor na sangs rgyas kyi gsung ni yon tan mtha' yas ba yin la skyon ni chen po gnyis te /
analyzed: mdor na sangs rgyas kyi gsung ni yon tan mtha' yas ba yin la skyon ni chen po gnyis te /
translated: In brief, the Buddha's speech has infinite good qualities, but there are two major faults:🔽it is extremely difficult to find,

original: shin tu rnyed par dka' ba dang / yun ring du mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu rnyed par dka' ba dang / yun ring du mi gnas pa'o //
translated: and it does not last long.

original: de lta bas na shin tu rings par gus par mnyan par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na shin tu rings par gus par mnyan par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, you should listen to it with the utmost respect.

original: rgyu gsum dag gis pags pa las su rung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyu gsum dag gis pags pa las su rung bar 'gyur te /
translated: There are three causes that make skin supple:

original: snum bsku ba dang / mnye ba dang / bsro ba rnams kyis so //
analyzed: snum bsku ba dang / mnye ba dang / bsro ba rnams kyis so //
translated: anointing, massaging, and warming.

original: de bzhin du sems kyang thos pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems kyang thos pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa rnams kyis so //
translated: Similarly, the mind becomes supple through listening, reflection, and meditation.

original: de lta bas na sems las su rung ba nyid du bya ba'i phyir thos pa la sogs pa dag la brtson 'grus bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na sems las su rung ba nyid du bya ba'i phyir thos pa la sogs pa dag la brtson 'grus bya'o //
translated: Therefore, in order to make the mind serviceable, one should apply effort to listening, etc.

original: gsum bo dag gi stobs kyis lam du 'gro ba rnams 'brog dgon pa'i lam las bde bar rgal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gsum bo dag gi stobs kyis lam du 'gro ba rnams 'brog dgon pa'i lam las bde bar rgal bar 'gyur te /
translated: Those who travel the path of cyclic existence cross the path of the wilderness of cyclic existence by the power of these three,

original: lam brgyags kyi stobs dang / bzhon pa'i stobs dang / ston pa po'i stobs kyis so //
analyzed: lam brgyags kyi stobs dang / bzhon pa'i stobs dang / ston pa po'i stobs kyis so //
translated: by the power of provisions, the power of vehicles, and the power of guides.

original: de bzhin du 'khor ba'i 'brog dgon pa'i lam las de'i lam du 'gro ba rnams sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / ye shes kyi stobs kyis so //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'khor ba'i 'brog dgon pa'i lam las de'i lam du 'gro ba rnams sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / ye shes kyi stobs kyis so //
translated: In the same way, those who travel the path of cyclic existence cross the path of the wilderness of cyclic existence by the power of generosity, the power of morality, and the power of wisdom.

original: 'di gsum char yang thos pa la rag lus so //
analyzed: 'di gsum char yang thos pa la rag lus so //
translated: All three of these depend on listening.

original: sangs rgyas kyi gsung la dad pa tsam gyis kyang sdig pa chen po dag zil gyis gnon te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gsung la dad pa tsam gyis kyang sdig pa chen po dag zil gyis gnon te /
translated: Even mere faith in the Buddha's word overwhelms great evil.

original: 'di ltar mi dge ba las dge ba stobs dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar mi dge ba las dge ba stobs dang ldan pas so //
translated: Thus, good is powerful in comparison with evil.

original: 'di ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
translated: How is this known?

original: khyad par rnam pa bcu dag gis te /
analyzed: khyad par rnam pa bcu dag gis te /
translated: It is known by ten kinds of distinctions.

original: 'du byed pa'i khyad par gyis ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba gnyis 'bad pa dang ma 'bad par mngon par 'dus byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du byed pa'i khyad par gyis ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba gnyis 'bad pa dang ma 'bad par mngon par 'dus byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The difference in their formation is due to the fact that the wholesome and unwholesome are formed through effort and without effort.

original: rnam pa'i khyad par gyis ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin dang phyin ci log gi rnam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa'i khyad par gyis ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin dang phyin ci log gi rnam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The difference in their aspect is due to the fact that they have the aspects of reality and unreality.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa'i khyad par gyis ni dge ba'i rtsa ba gsum dag dang / mi dge ba'i rtsa ba gnyis sam gcig gis kyang mtshungs @126a * //🔽par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa'i khyad par gyis ni dge ba'i rtsa ba gsum dag dang / mi dge ba'i rtsa ba gnyis sam gcig gis kyang mtshungs @126a * // par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The difference in their concomitance is due to the fact that they are concomitant with the three roots of wholesomeness and the two or one roots of unwholesomeness.

original: sa'i khyad par gyis ni sa thams cad dang sa gcig pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa'i khyad par gyis ni sa thams cad dang sa gcig pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The difference in their stage is due to the fact that they are in all stages and in one stage.

original: 'bras bu'i grangs kyi khyad par gyis ni 'bras bu rnam pa lnga dang bzhi yin pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i grangs kyi khyad par gyis ni 'bras bu rnam pa lnga dang bzhi yin pa'i phyir ro /
translated: The difference in the number of their fruits is due to the fact that they have five and four kinds of fruits, respectively.

original: 'bras bu'i mthar phyin pa'i khyad par gyis ni dus khyad par du 'phags pa dang ngan pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i mthar phyin pa'i khyad par gyis ni dus khyad par du 'phags pa dang ngan pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The difference in the excellence of their fruits is due to the fact that they have excellent and inferior fruits.

original: 'di ltar dge ba'i 'bras bu ni bskal pa chen po brgyad khri'i bar du 'byung la /
analyzed: 'di ltar dge ba'i 'bras bu ni bskal pa chen po brgyad khri'i bar du 'byung la /
translated: Thus, the result of virtue arises for up to eighty thousand great eons,

original: mi dge ba'i ni bar gyi bskal pa'i bar du yin pas so //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i ni bar gyi bskal pa'i bar du yin pas so //
translated: but the result of nonvirtue arises for up to an intermediate eon.

original: yang dag par 'chad pa'i khyad par gyis ni 'di ltar dge ba ni mi dge bas dus re zhig tu yang dag par 'chad pa yin gyi mi dge ba ni dge bas gtan du yin pas so //
analyzed: yang dag par 'chad pa'i khyad par gyis ni 'di ltar dge ba ni mi dge bas dus re zhig tu yang dag par 'chad pa yin gyi mi dge ba ni dge bas gtan du yin pas so //
translated: The distinction of complete cessation is that virtue completely ceases nonvirtue for a while, but nonvirtue does not completely cease virtue.

original: chung dus mang po yang dag par 'joms pa'i khyad par gyis ni 'di ltar spong ba'i lam skad cig ma gcig gis thog ma med pa'i dus nas zhugs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam pa mang po yang dag par 'joms pas so //
analyzed: chung dus mang po yang dag par 'joms pa'i khyad par gyis ni 'di ltar spong ba'i lam skad cig ma gcig gis thog ma med pa'i dus nas zhugs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam pa mang po yang dag par 'joms pas so //
translated: The distinction of destroying many with a small amount is that a single moment of the path of abandonment completely destroys many aspects of its opposing factors that have been engaged since beginningless time.

original: spong pa'i khyad par gyis ni 'di ltar gnyen po skyes pas mi dge ba spong gi dge ba ni ma yin pas so //
analyzed: spong pa'i khyad par gyis ni 'di ltar gnyen po skyes pas mi dge ba spong gi dge ba ni ma yin pas so //
translated: The distinction of abandonment is that nonvirtue is abandoned by the arising of its antidote, but virtue is not.

original: phyogs kyi khyad par gyis ni 'di ltar dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos yongs su 'dzin pa la sangs rgyas 'khor dang bcas pa'i phyogs dang bdud yin te go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: phyogs kyi khyad par gyis ni 'di ltar dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos yongs su 'dzin pa la sangs rgyas 'khor dang bcas pa'i phyogs dang bdud yin te go rims bzhin no //
translated: The distinction of direction is that the side of the Buddha and his retinue is the side that holds virtue and nonvirtue, respectively, while the side of Mara is the opposite.

original: dpe rnams ni snang ba dang / mun pa dang / bkru sman dang / skyon dang / rdo rje dang / ri dang / seng ge dang / ri dags kyi khyu zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa dag yin no //
analyzed: dpe rnams ni snang ba dang / mun pa dang / bkru sman dang / skyon dang / rdo rje dang / ri dang / seng ge dang / ri dags kyi khyu zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa dag yin no //
translated: The similes are light, darkness, medicine, a fault, a diamond, a mountain, a lion, and a herd of deer.

original: dge ba de dang sa gcig pa yin yang dang po'i khyad par rnam pa gsum po rnams kyis mi dge bas stobs dang ldan par rig par bya'o /
analyzed: dge ba de dang sa gcig pa yin yang dang po'i khyad par rnam pa gsum po rnams kyis mi dge bas stobs dang ldan par rig par bya'o /
translated: Even though virtue and nonvirtue are on the same level, nonvirtue is stronger than virtue in three ways, and this should be understood.

original: mi dge ba zil gyis mnan nas de'i gnyan po dge ba gzhan 'dren pa'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: mi dge ba zil gyis mnan nas de'i gnyan po dge ba gzhan 'dren pa'i yang phyir ro //
translated: Because it is difficult to overcome nonvirtue and to bring forth its antidote, virtue.

original: bsdus pa'i tshigs su bcad pa ni /
analyzed: bsdus pa'i tshigs su bcad pa ni /
translated: A verse summarizing the chapter

original: 'du byed rnam pa mtshungs par ldan //
analyzed: 'du byed rnam pa mtshungs par ldan //
translated: The formations associated with the same stage

original: sa nyid 'bras bu rnam gnyis nyid //
analyzed: sa nyid 'bras bu rnam gnyis nyid //
translated: are the cause of the two results,

original: 'chad dang chung dus yang dag 'joms //
analyzed: 'chad dang chung dus yang dag 'joms //
translated: the homogeneous cause and the concomitant cause.

original: spong dang phyogs kyi khyad par nyid//
analyzed: spong dang phyogs kyi khyad par nyid//
translated: The distinctions of abandonment and stage.🔽🔽

original: sangs rgyas kyi ni gsung 'di ni //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ni gsung 'di ni //
translated: The Buddha’s teaching is a medicine, a raft, a light, an island, a refuge, a mother, a father, and a friend.

original: sman dang grub dang gtan du dang // nad kun 'joms dang gnyis med dang // legs 'thob legs brten bsgrub dka' na //
analyzed: sman dang grub dang gtan du dang // nad kun 'joms dang gnyis med dang // legs 'thob legs brten bsgrub dka' na //
translated: It is a medicine because it cures the disease of the passions. It is a raft because it enables one to cross the river of suffering. It is a light because it dispels the darkness of delusion. It is an island because it does not abandon those who are in danger. It is a refuge because it protects from the fears of the life-cycle. It is a mother because it gives birth to the sons of the victors. It is a father because it generates the sons of the victors. It is a friend because it does not abandon those who are in danger.

original: nad drag yun rings su mi sten //
analyzed: nad drag yun rings su mi sten //
translated: One should not rely on a doctor who does not cure a serious or chronic illness.

original: mi shes pa ni bstan nus kyi //
analyzed: mi shes pa ni bstan nus kyi //
translated: One can show the way to the ignorant,

original: gang zhig de mi 'dod pa ni //
analyzed: gang zhig de mi 'dod pa ni //
translated: but one cannot make the unwilling go.

original: gnyen po bya ba'i @126b dgra yin pas //
analyzed: gnyen po bya ba'i @126b dgra yin pas //
translated: The enemy who opposes the remedy

original: de bcos mi rung rig par bya //
analyzed: de bcos mi rung rig par bya //
translated: should be known as incurable.

original: de lta bas na bcos su mi rung bar gyur na mi rung ngo snyam nas sangs rgyas kyi gsung la brten pa la 'bad pa dang ldan pa dag tu bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na bcos su mi rung bar gyur na mi rung ngo snyam nas sangs rgyas kyi gsung la brten pa la 'bad pa dang ldan pa dag tu bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should strive to rely on the Buddha’s teaching, thinking, “It is not right to be incurable.”

original: dam pa rnams las gang zag gnyis smad par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: dam pa rnams las gang zag gnyis smad par bya ba yin te /
translated: Two kinds of people are to be despised by the holy:

original: gang zhig dam pa'i chos mi nyan pa dang / gang zhig phan yon gang yin pa de mi 'thob pa de lta bur nyan pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig dam pa'i chos mi nyan pa dang / gang zhig phan yon gang yin pa de mi 'thob pa de lta bur nyan pa'o //
translated: those who do not listen to the holy Dharma, and those who listen in such a way as not to obtain the benefit.

original: de la / don du mi gnyer rgyud g-yeng dang // rmugs dang gnyid log mi nyan pa'o //
analyzed: de la / don du mi gnyer rgyud g-yeng dang // rmugs dang gnyid log mi nyan pa'o //
translated: sloth, sleep, and not listening.

original: phan yon la ni shes rab 'chal //
analyzed: phan yon la ni shes rab 'chal //
translated: The benefits are: not having bad wisdom,

original: rnyed sogs 'dod sdang bcas mi brten //
analyzed: rnyed sogs 'dod sdang bcas mi brten //
translated: not relying on desire, hatred, and so on.

original: de lta bas na mi nyan par gyur na mi rung ba dang / phan yon la mi brten par gyur na mi rung ngo snyam nas ji skad du bstan pa'i skyon bsal ba la 'bad pa dang ldan pa dag tu bya'o //

translated: Therefore, thinking “It is not right not to listen,” and “It is not right not to rely on the benefits,” one should be diligent in removing the faults as they have been taught.

original: gsung dang rna ba nyid dang ni //
analyzed: gsung dang rna ba nyid dang ni //
translated: The five are: speech, the ear,

original: 'dod dang shes rab bgegs med pa //
analyzed: 'dod dang shes rab bgegs med pa //
translated: desire, wisdom, and no obstacles.

original: lnga ni gang phyir rnyed dka' bas //
analyzed: lnga ni gang phyir rnyed dka' bas //
translated: Since these five are difficult to obtain,

original: de phyir thub pa'i gsung mnyan bya //
analyzed: de phyir thub pa'i gsung mnyan bya //
translated: therefore one should listen to the Sage’s speech.

original: dam pa'i chos ni rnyed gyur cing //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos ni rnyed gyur cing //
translated: Even though one has found the holy Dharma🔽and has faith, if one’s mind is weak,

original: dad dang ldan yang blo chung dag / yi dags mgrin pa khab 'dra bar //
analyzed: dad dang ldan yang blo chung dag / yi dags mgrin pa khab 'dra bar //
translated: like a hungry ghost with a throat like a needle,

original: de ni btung bar mi nus so //
analyzed: de ni btung bar mi nus so //
translated: one will be unable to drink it.

original: de lta bas na ji srid du lnga po rnyed pa dang / de btung bar nus pa de srid du dam pa'i chos mnyan pa la 'bad par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na ji srid du lnga po rnyed pa dang / de btung bar nus pa de srid du dam pa'i chos mnyan pa la 'bad par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, as long as you can find the five and can drink them, you should strive to listen to the holy Dharma.

original: zab mo goms par ma byas pas //
analyzed: zab mo goms par ma byas pas //
translated: Because you are not accustomed to the profound,

original: thub pa'i gsung ni rnyed dka' ste //
analyzed: thub pa'i gsung ni rnyed dka' ste //
translated: the Sage’s teachings are hard to find.

original: de med par ni thar pa med //
analyzed: de med par ni thar pa med //
translated: Without them, there is no liberation.

original: thar pa 'dod pa rnams kyis ni //
analyzed: thar pa 'dod pa rnams kyis ni //
translated: Therefore, those who desire liberation

original: de phyir gus par mnyan par bya //🔽'di ltar 'di la brten nas myur sdug kha na ma tho med //
analyzed: de phyir gus par mnyan par bya // 'di ltar 'di la brten nas myur sdug kha na ma tho med //
translated: should listen with respect.🔽For, in dependence on them, you can quickly and happily attain

original: phul byung nges par 'bras bu mi zad 'thob pa bder nus kyi //
analyzed: phul byung nges par 'bras bu mi zad 'thob pa bder nus kyi //
translated: the excellent, certain, inexhaustible fruit, free of suffering.

original: thabs gzhan med la sgrub pa po yang med cing gang zhig la //
analyzed: thabs gzhan med la sgrub pa po yang med cing gang zhig la //
translated: There is no other method, and there is no practitioner

original: ma byas na yang bde ba med pas de bya mod //
analyzed: ma byas na yang bde ba med pas de bya mod //
translated: who can be happy without practicing them.🔽The Sage’s teachings are endowed with fruit,

original: thub pa'i gsung ni 'bras bu dang // don dang tshig 'bru ldan pa ni //
analyzed: thub pa'i gsung ni 'bras bu dang // don dang tshig 'bru ldan pa ni //
translated: meaning, and good words.🔽They are to be followed when you hear them, reflect on them,

original: thos pa'i dus dang bsam pa dang // bsgom ba dag na'ang rjes su 'dzin //
analyzed: thos pa'i dus dang bsam pa dang // bsgom ba dag na'ang rjes su 'dzin //
translated: and meditate on them.

original: go 'byed nges tshig bzang po yi //
analyzed: go 'byed nges tshig bzang po yi //
translated: They are well-ordered and have good definitions.

original: yon tan gnyis ldan thub pa'i gsung //
analyzed: yon tan gnyis ldan thub pa'i gsung //
translated: The speech of the Sage has two qualities.🔽It is meaningful, appropriate,

original: don dang ldan zhing ji 'os dang // phan dang gtan gyi 'bras bu ldan //
analyzed: don dang ldan zhing ji 'os dang // phan dang gtan gyi 'bras bu ldan //
translated: beneficial, and has the result of lasting happiness.

original: gang phyir 'di don kun 'grub 'byung gnas yin //
analyzed: gang phyir 'di don kun 'grub 'byung gnas yin //
translated: It is the source of the accomplishment of all aims.

original: thabs bde ba dang shin tu rnyed dka' bas //
analyzed: thabs bde ba dang shin tu rnyed dka' bas //
translated: It is the means of happiness and the most difficult to attain.

original: de phyir 'grub ba don gnyer srog 'gyur ba //
analyzed: de phyir 'grub ba don gnyer srog 'gyur ba //
translated: Therefore, those who seek accomplishment should value it.

original: dad dang ldan pas 'di la brtun par bya //
analyzed: dad dang ldan pas 'di la brtun par bya //
translated: Those who have faith should be diligent in it.🔽One should abandon the three faults of a vessel,🔽which are stains, overturning, and leaking.

original: mi shes pa dang @127a * //🔽the tshom shes //
analyzed: mi shes pa dang @127a * // the tshom shes //
translated: One should know ignorance,🔽doubt, and wrong knowledge.🔽One should turn away from wrong knowledge

original: log pa'i shes pa ldog pa dang // bden pa rnams ni rtogs 'gyur ba //
analyzed: log pa'i shes pa ldog pa dang // bden pa rnams ni rtogs 'gyur ba //
translated: and realize the truths.

original: dam chos mnyan pa'i yon tan no //
analyzed: dam chos mnyan pa'i yon tan no //
translated: These are the qualities of listening to the holy Dharma.

original: dam pa'i chos mnyan pa la phan yon lnga gsungs pa gang dag yin pa ni bzhi po 'di dag tu 'dus te gnyis kyis mi shes pa bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos mnyan pa la phan yon lnga gsungs pa gang dag yin pa ni bzhi po 'di dag tu 'dus te gnyis kyis mi shes pa bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The five benefits of listening to the holy Dharma are included in these four, because two of them cause the abandonment of ignorance.

original: sems ni srog chags padma 'dra //
analyzed: sems ni srog chags padma 'dra //
translated: The mind is like a lotus, a living being.

original: stobs kyis dam pa'i chos la glan //
analyzed: stobs kyis dam pa'i chos la glan //
translated: By the power of the holy Dharma, it is opened.

original: de phyir don gyi ro rnyed na //
analyzed: de phyir don gyi ro rnyed na //
translated: Therefore, having found the taste of the meaning,

original: de la g-yo ba med par gnas //
analyzed: de la g-yo ba med par gnas //
translated: one should remain in it without wavering.

original: de lta bas na stobs kyis kyang dam pa'i chos mnyan pa la glan par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na stobs kyis kyang dam pa'i chos mnyan pa la glan par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, even by force, one should listen to the holy Dharma.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: dngos po'i 'dod pa nyon mongs pa'i 'dod pa dang bcas pa rnams kyang de dang chos mthun pa yin te /
translated: The desire for things is similar to that, along with the desire for afflictions.

original: de la mi 'phrogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid ni shes par dka' ba nyid kyis ston te /
analyzed: de la mi 'phrogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid ni shes par dka' ba nyid kyis ston te /

original: nyes dmigs yongs su mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyes dmigs yongs su mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the disadvantages are not fully understood.

original: brtan pa nyid ni bzlog par dka' ba nyid kyis te /
analyzed: brtan pa nyid ni bzlog par dka' ba nyid kyis te /
translated: Stability is shown by the difficulty of turning it back.

original: bsal bar dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsal bar dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is difficult to remove.

original: stobs dang ldan pa nyid kyis ni dpung thub par dka' ba nyid kyis te /
analyzed: stobs dang ldan pa nyid kyis ni dpung thub par dka' ba nyid kyis te /
translated: Power is shown by the difficulty of withstanding it.

original: kun du rgyu ba rnam par gnas par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun du rgyu ba rnam par gnas par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is difficult to stay in the path of the bodhisattva, because it is far away and difficult to traverse.

original: thag ring zhing thibs por rgyu ba nyid ni rgyu ba rtogs par dka' ba nyid kyis @132b te ;
analyzed: thag ring zhing thibs por rgyu ba nyid ni rgyu ba rtogs par dka' ba nyid kyis @132b te ;
translated: It is far away and difficult to traverse because it is difficult to understand the path.

original: bag la nyal ba ni thag ring du zhugs shing mi mngon par song ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bag la nyal ba ni thag ring du zhugs shing mi mngon par song ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is far away because the latent states are hidden and not manifest.

original: snying brtse ba med pa nyid ni bzang po'i lam 'joms pa la sogs pa nyid kyis te /
analyzed: snying brtse ba med pa nyid ni bzang po'i lam 'joms pa la sogs pa nyid kyis te /
translated: It is without compassion because it destroys the good path.

original: dge ba ma lus par med par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba ma lus par med par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It destroys all that is good.

original: dus shes pa nyid ni gnyid log pa dang ra ro zhing myos pa lta bu'i 'dod chags dang ; dga' ba'i dbang po can rnams la 'joms pa'i phyir //
analyzed: dus shes pa nyid ni gnyid log pa dang ra ro zhing myos pa lta bu'i 'dod chags dang ; dga' ba'i dbang po can rnams la 'joms pa'i phyir //
translated: It is not timely because it destroys those who are intoxicated with the faculties of passion and joy, as if they were asleep or drunk.

original: mi mthun pa nyid ni mi dge ba nyid kyis dge ba dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro / nang bar mar me rlung gis bskyod pa 'dra ba dang // chu bo'i 'gram gyi ljon shing rtsa ba 'gul 'dra dang // snod chag yod pa'i chu ni 'dzag par byed pa ltar //
analyzed: mi mthun pa nyid ni mi dge ba nyid kyis dge ba dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro / nang bar mar me rlung gis bskyod pa 'dra ba dang // chu bo'i 'gram gyi ljon shing rtsa ba 'gul 'dra dang // snod chag yod pa'i chu ni 'dzag par byed pa ltar //
translated: like water in a cracked pot,

original: 'gro ba 'di ni dbang med 'jig ba'i chos can yin //
analyzed: 'gro ba 'di ni dbang med 'jig ba'i chos can yin //
translated: this world is powerless, subject to destruction.

original: de ltar 'gro ba rab tu 'jig pa'i chos can yin na /
analyzed: de ltar 'gro ba rab tu 'jig pa'i chos can yin na /
translated: Thus, this world is subject to destruction.

original: khyed dam pa'i chos mnyan par g-yeng ba'i mi rigs so //
analyzed: khyed dam pa'i chos mnyan par g-yeng ba'i mi rigs so //
translated: It is not right for you to be distracted from listening to the holy Dharma.

original: ci'i phyir tshigs su bad pa 'di las dpe gsum dag gis bstan zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir tshigs su bad pa 'di las dpe gsum dag gis bstan zhe na /
translated: Why are three examples taught in this verse?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows.

original: 'gro ba zhes bya 'di ni tshe yi dbang gis ming dang gzugs //
analyzed: 'gro ba zhes bya 'di ni tshe yi dbang gis ming dang gzugs //
translated: This so-called world is name-and-form, which is under the power of life.

original: 'jug yin gsum po de phyir ji lta bur //
analyzed: 'jug yin gsum po de phyir ji lta bur //
translated: Therefore, how can it be

original: mi brtan pa de 'chi ba 'gyel zad la //
analyzed: mi brtan pa de 'chi ba 'gyel zad la //
translated: unstable, subject to death, falling, and exhaustion?

original: phyogs pa'i mar me ljon chu yis bstan //
analyzed: phyogs pa'i mar me ljon chu yis bstan //
translated: This is taught by the examples of the lamp, the tree, and the water.

original: gzhan yang rgyu brgyad dag gis chos 'di la shin tu brtsal ba rmi bya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rgyu brgyad dag gis chos 'di la shin tu brtsal ba rmi bya bar 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, this Dharma is to be sought by means of eight causes.

original: gal te thar ba don du mi gnyer ba yin pa dang / nad med pa ma yin pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: gal te thar ba don du mi gnyer ba yin pa dang / nad med pa ma yin pa'i phyir ram /
translated: If one does not seek liberation, either because one does not desire it or because one is not capable of it,🔽or if one is capable of it but does not seek it, then the result will not be present.🔽If one seeks it, one will not definitely achieve it.

original: rang dbang med pa nyid kyi phyir gnyer na yang mi nus pa yin pa dang / gal te nus na yang brtsal ba ma byas par yang 'bras bu yod pa ma yin pa dang / gzhan gyi byed pa po gzhan yin pa dang / brtsal ba byas kyang nges 'grub par mi 'gyur pa dang /

translated: One will not have confidence in the one who has achieved it.🔽One will not know how to seek it.🔽One will not have the skill in means to think, “I will seek it.”

original: 'dis grub pa po snyam du yid ches par mi byed pa yin pa dang / bdag gis ji ltar brtson par bya zhes thabs mi mkhas pa yin pa dang / ngan song las yang dag par rgal ba'i dbugs phyin pa thog pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis grub pa po snyam du yid ches par mi byed pa yin pa dang / bdag gis ji ltar brtson par bya zhes thabs mi mkhas pa yin pa dang / ngan song las yang dag par rgal ba'i dbugs phyin pa thog pa yin no //
translated: One will not have the relief of having crossed over the lower realms.

original: 'on te yang /🔽don gnyer nus dang ma byas par //
analyzed: 'on te yang /🔽don gnyer nus dang ma byas par //
translated: But if one does seek it,🔽one will be capable of seeking it.

analyzed: 'bras med po gzhan med pa dang / nges par 'grub dang yid ches dang // thabs shes log par ltung ba yi //
translated: and those who have the wisdom,

original: mtha' la gnas pa'i skye bo gang //
analyzed: mtha' la gnas pa'i skye bo gang //
translated: and those who have the power,🔽and those who have the courage,

original: shin tu rtsol bar mi byed pa //
analyzed: shin tu rtsol bar mi byed pa //
translated: and those who have the perseverance,🔽and those who have the right view,

original: de ni nges par sdig las kyis //
analyzed: de ni nges par sdig las kyis //
translated: and those who have the right conduct,🔽and those who have the right livelihood,

original: bsgribs shing sdug bsngal mang bstan yin //
analyzed: bsgribs shing sdug bsngal mang bstan yin //
translated: and those who have the right effort,

original: ngan song thos la yid ches shing //
analyzed: ngan song thos la yid ches shing //
translated: and those who have the right mindfulness,

original: de yi gnyen tho mi byed la /
analyzed: de yi gnyen tho mi byed la /
translated: and those who have the right concentration,

original: @133a * // 'jigs shing nus dang ldan pa dag / tshe thung de yang ma nges dang // mi bya bar ni bya min dang // byed po gzhan med pa byas par //
analyzed: @133a * // 'jigs shing nus dang ldan pa dag / tshe thung de yang ma nges dang // mi bya bar ni bya min dang // byed po gzhan med pa byas par //

original: bde las med cing byas pa yang //
analyzed: bde las med cing byas pa yang //
translated: and those who have the right conduct of liberation,🔽and those who have the right wisdom,

original: mi 'jigs de byed mi shes min //
analyzed: mi 'jigs de byed mi shes min //
translated: and those who have the right knowledge and conduct,🔽and those who have the right path,🔽and those who have the right practice,🔽and those who have the right attainment,🔽and those who have the right realization,🔽and those who have the right fruit,🔽and those who have the right end,

analyzed: gal te so so'i skye bo dag /'dod pa yis ni zang zing gi / phub ma la ni yongs 'jus nas //
translated: and those who have the right knowledge of the destruction of defilements,🔽and those who have the right knowledge of the non-arising of defilements,

analyzed: kye ma 'di ni rab myong ba'i // glang chen nyal ba byed dam ci //
translated: and those who have the right knowledge of the path leading to the cessation of suffering,🔽and those who have the right knowledge of the cessation of suffering,🔽and those who have the right knowledge of the cessation of the path,🔽and those who have the right knowledge of the cessation of the fruit,🔽and those who have the right knowledge of the cessation of the end,🔽and those who have the right knowledge of the cessation of the destruction of defilements,

original: byis pa kun ni rten yod kyang //
analyzed: byis pa kun ni rten yod kyang //
translated: and those who have the right knowledge of the cessation of the non-arising of defilements,🔽and those who have the right knowledge of the cessation of the path leading to the cessation of suffering,🔽and those who have the right knowledge of the cessation of the cessation of suffering,🔽and those who have the right knowledge of the cessation of the cessation of the path,🔽and those who have the right knowledge of the cessation of the cessation of the fruit,🔽and those who have the right knowledge of the cessation of the cessation of the end,🔽and those who have the right knowledge of the cessation of the cessation of the destruction of defilements,🔽and those who have the right knowledge of the cessation of the cessation of the non-arising of defilements,🔽and

original: kye ma mi bzad kye ma dka' //
analyzed: kye ma mi bzad kye ma dka' //
translated: Alas, how terrible! Alas, how difficult!

original: kye ma sdug bsngal kye ma 'jigs //
analyzed: kye ma sdug bsngal kye ma 'jigs //
translated: Alas, how painful! Alas, how frightening!

original: kye ma'o brlag la phyogs pa yin //
analyzed: kye ma'o brlag la phyogs pa yin //
translated: Alas, they are heading for destruction!

original: sangs rgyas gsung zhes bya ba gang //
analyzed: sangs rgyas gsung zhes bya ba gang //
translated: What is called the Buddha’s teaching

original: dkon mchog 'dod don sgrub mdzad pa //🔽skye bo ser sna med 'dug pas //
analyzed: dkon mchog 'dod don sgrub mdzad pa // skye bo ser sna med 'dug pas //
translated: is the means for accomplishing the aims of the Three Jewels.

original: gand'i brdungs te sgrogs byed na //🔽gti mug nga rgyal mdongs pa yi //
analyzed: gand'i brdungs te sgrogs byed na // gti mug nga rgyal mdongs pa yi //
translated: When it is beaten on the drum of the world🔽and proclaimed to the greedy,

original: byis pa 'di dag bdag nyid la //
analyzed: byis pa 'di dag bdag nyid la //
translated: these childish beings, blinded by delusion and pride,🔽will make it the cause of their own destruction,

original: dgra bo bzhin du brlag pa'i rgyu //
analyzed: dgra bo bzhin du brlag pa'i rgyu //
translated: as if it were an enemy.

original: grong ba'i dgra la mngon par dga' //
analyzed: grong ba'i dgra la mngon par dga' //
translated: They delight in the enemy of the city.

original: bdag la phan par brtson rnams kyis ni dgra yin na yang legs bshad gzung //
analyzed: bdag la phan par brtson rnams kyis ni dgra yin na yang legs bshad gzung //
translated: Even if it is an enemy, those who strive to help themselves should accept good advice.

original: ngan pa yin kyang skye bos phan 'dogs skye bo'i dor ni dpyad bya na //
analyzed: ngan pa yin kyang skye bos phan 'dogs skye bo'i dor ni dpyad bya na //
translated: If a person is wicked, one should examine the help that people offer.

original: dgra bcom pa nyid 'gro ba phan pa dpung gnyen phan pa gsungs pa yi //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid 'gro ba phan pa dpung gnyen phan pa gsungs pa yi //
translated: If one does not accept the advice of the Buddha, the protector of the world, the friend of the world, the one who speaks for the benefit of the world,

original: gsung ni gal te mi 'dzin gyi hud tshig ni 'dir byas legs //
analyzed: gsung ni gal te mi 'dzin gyi hud tshig ni 'dir byas legs //
translated: then alas, one should be called a fool.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'di rnams kyis ni ji ltar byis ba rnams la mya ngan du bya ba de yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'di rnams kyis ni ji ltar byis ba rnams la mya ngan du bya ba de yongs su bstan to //
translated: These verses show how the foolish grieve.

original: ji ltar na byis pa rnams mya ngan du bya ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na byis pa rnams mya ngan du bya ba yin zhe na /
translated: How do the foolish grieve?

original: log par bsgrub pa skyon lnga dang ldan pa la gnas pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: log par bsgrub pa skyon lnga dang ldan pa la gnas pa'i phyir ro /
translated: Because they are attached to the five faults of false practice.

original: log par bsgrub pa de yang tshigs su bcad pa gzhan gsum dag gis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: log par bsgrub pa de yang tshigs su bcad pa gzhan gsum dag gis bstan pa yin no //
translated: False practice is shown by the next three verses.

original: de yang mdor bsdu na sangs rgyas kyi gsung mi nyan pa dang / mi 'dzin pa las brtsams nas rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang mdor bsdu na sangs rgyas kyi gsung mi nyan pa dang / mi 'dzin pa las brtsams nas rig par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, it should be understood that this is summarized in the verse beginning with “not listening to the Buddha’s word” and “not taking it up.”

original: sangs rgyas kyi gsung gang rnyed par dka' ba dang / don che ba dang / 'bad pa med par 'thob ba bzhin du gti mug gis ldongs pa nyid kyis bag med pa'i rgyu 'khrig pa dang ldan pa'i sgra dag la chags nas nyan du mi 'dod pa dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gsung gang rnyed par dka' ba dang / don che ba dang / 'bad pa med par 'thob ba bzhin du gti mug gis ldongs pa nyid kyis bag med pa'i rgyu 'khrig pa dang ldan pa'i sgra dag la chags nas nyan du mi 'dod pa dang /
translated: The Buddha’s word is like a treasure, difficult to obtain, of great value, and obtained without effort. But the foolish, blinded by delusion, attached to the sounds of love which is the cause of heedlessness, do not want to listen to it.

original: thos na yang phan pa bzhed pa dang / phan pa'i bla mas gsungs pa la mi bsgrub pas mi 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: thos na yang phan pa bzhed pa dang / phan pa'i bla mas gsungs pa la mi bsgrub pas mi 'dzin pa'o //
translated: He is one who is concerned with what is beneficial, and he is one who is not held back by the failure to practice the teachings of a beneficial spiritual teacher.

original: skyon lnga gang dag ce na /
analyzed: skyon lnga gang dag ce na /
translated: What are the five faults?

original: mi bzad pa nyid dang / dka' ba nyid dang / sdug bsngal ba nyid dang / 'jigs pa nyid dang / brlag pa la phyogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: mi bzad pa nyid dang / dka' ba nyid dang / sdug bsngal ba nyid dang / 'jigs pa nyid dang / brlag pa la phyogs pa nyid do //
translated: They are the fault of being unbearable, the fault of being difficult, the fault of being painful, the fault of being fearful, and the fault of being destructive.

original: gnyen po srid pa yod @133b kyang log par bsgrub pa gang la skyon lnga yod pa de yang mi bzad pa la sogs pa'i sgrar bstan to //
analyzed: gnyen po srid pa yod @133b kyang log par bsgrub pa gang la skyon lnga yod pa de yang mi bzad pa la sogs pa'i sgrar bstan to //
translated: Although the antidotes exist, the five faults are taught by the words “unbearable,” etc., in regard to the wrong practice.

original: ci mi bzad pa ni de phyis gdung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ci mi bzad pa ni de phyis gdung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: What is unbearable? It is the cause of later remorse,

original: 'di ltar gang gis gdungs bar 'gyur ba de byas nas mi bzad pa byas so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gis gdungs bar 'gyur ba de byas nas mi bzad pa byas so zhes zer ro //
translated: because one says, “I have done what is unbearable.”

original: dka' ba ni mang po kun du tshol bas dub pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dka' ba ni mang po kun du tshol bas dub pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: What is difficult? It is the cause of fatigue from the pursuit of many things.

original: sdug bsngal ba ni lus dang sems la gnod pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba ni lus dang sems la gnod pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: What is painful? It is the cause of harm to body and mind.

original: gsod pa dang / 'ching ba dang / rdeg ba la sogs pa gzhan gyi gnod pa dang mya ngan gyi gnas yin pa nyid kyis so //🔽'jigs pa ni ngan 'gro 'gro ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsod pa dang / 'ching ba dang / rdeg ba la sogs pa gzhan gyi gnod pa dang mya ngan gyi gnas yin pa nyid kyis so // 'jigs pa ni ngan 'gro 'gro ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and because of the suffering of the grief of others.

original: brlag pa la phyogs pa nyid ni mya ngan na las 'das pa'i lam dang thag ring bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brlag pa la phyogs pa nyid ni mya ngan na las 'das pa'i lam dang thag ring bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the suffering of fear, because of the suffering of the cause of the miserable planes of existence.

original: kye ma'o zhes bya ba'i tshig gi phrad 'di ni ya mtshan gyi don la yang mthong ste /
analyzed: kye ma'o zhes bya ba'i tshig gi phrad 'di ni ya mtshan gyi don la yang mthong ste /
translated: The expression “alas” is also seen in the sense of wonder,🔽as when the son of Bāṣpa, having been converted, exclaimed, “Alas!

original: dper na bad sa'i bus mngon par dang nas kye ma 'on sangs rgyas kye ma'o chos ni legs par gsungs pa zhes smras pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bad sa'i bus mngon par dang nas kye ma 'on sangs rgyas kye ma'o chos ni legs par gsungs pa zhes smras pa lta bu'o //
translated: The Dharma of the Buddha is well-spoken!”🔽It is also seen in the sense of grief, as when the earth-juice disappeared and people lamented, “Alas!

original: mya ngan byed ba'i don la yang sa'i bcud nub pa dang kye ma'o sa'i bcud kye ma'o sa'i bcud ces mya ngan byas pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: mya ngan byed ba'i don la yang sa'i bcud nub pa dang kye ma'o sa'i bcud kye ma'o sa'i bcud ces mya ngan byas pa lta bu'o //
translated: The earth-juice!🔽Alas! The earth-juice!”

original: smon pa'i don la yang ma la kye ma'o //
analyzed: smon pa'i don la yang ma la kye ma'o //
translated: It is also seen in the sense of aspiration, as when one says, “Alas, my mother!”

original: bdag mi skal ba bzang po rnams dang skal ba mnyam pa nyid du skye bar shog shig ces bya ba lta bu'o /
analyzed: bdag mi skal ba bzang po rnams dang skal ba mnyam pa nyid du skye bar shog shig ces bya ba lta bu'o /
translated: May I be born in a place where I will be equal to those who are fortunate!

original: smad pa'i don la yang dper na rkun po byed pa na kye ma bram ze'i legs pa yin no zhes bya ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: smad pa'i don la yang dper na rkun po byed pa na kye ma bram ze'i legs pa yin no zhes bya ba lta bu ste /
translated: In the sense of contempt, for example, Oh, what a good Brahmin! when someone is stealing.

original: de ni 'dir mya ngan byed pa'i don du blta bar bya'o //🔽rkun po zhig gis rab brgyad phug ste /
analyzed: de ni 'dir mya ngan byed pa'i don du blta bar bya'o // rkun po zhig gis rab brgyad phug ste /
translated: Here, it should be understood in the sense of to grieve.

analyzed: rgyal po'i mdzod du zhugs nas skom pas chang zhim po 'thungs te ra ro nas nyal ba dang nang par bzung nas sdug bsngal bar byas zhes grag go //
translated: A thief broke into a house and drank the delicious wine that was there. He became drunk and fell asleep. In the morning, he was caught and suffered greatly.

original: de bzhin du khyed kyis mi khom pa'i rab brgyad phug ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du khyed kyis mi khom pa'i rab brgyad phug ste /
translated: In the same way, you have broken into the house of the eight freedoms,

original: dal bar skyes pa'i rgyal po'i mdzod du zhugs nas 'dod pa la dga' ba'i chang 'thungs te ra ro ba nyid kyis srog gi mtshan mo'i nam nang na bdag nyid la sdug bsngal bskyed pa ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: dal bar skyes pa'i rgyal po'i mdzod du zhugs nas 'dod pa la dga' ba'i chang 'thungs te ra ro ba nyid kyis srog gi mtshan mo'i nam nang na bdag nyid la sdug bsngal bskyed pa ni mi rigs so //
translated: entered the treasury of the human condition, and drunk the wine of delight in desire. You are drunk and asleep. It is not right for you to bring suffering upon yourself in the night of death!🔽 🔽House means the body, which is the abode of the self.

original: phag mo thi ba'i phreng lang na ma'i sngon gyi tshul yang brjod par bya ste /🔽de bzhin du dam pa'i chos ma mnyan pas sems can rnams mngon par mtho ba'i 'gro bar skyes nas shugs zad pas mda' gnam du 'phangs bslar sa la ltung ba bzhin du yang ngan 'gror 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phag mo thi ba'i phreng lang na ma'i sngon gyi tshul yang brjod par bya ste / de bzhin du dam pa'i chos ma mnyan pas sems can rnams mngon par mtho ba'i 'gro bar skyes nas shugs zad pas mda' gnam du 'phangs bslar sa la ltung ba bzhin du yang ngan 'gror 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The story of the sow and the young quail is also to be told.

original: de lta @134a * //
analyzed: de lta @134a * //
translated: In the same way, beings, having been born in a happy realm of existence by not listening to the true teaching, fall back into a miserable realm of existence, like an arrow shot into the air falling to the ground when its strength is spent.

analyzed: gang zhig gzhan gyis brgal na snyan par smra byed rtsub pa ma yin dang // bstod dam grub par gyur kyang gang gi yid ni rgyags par mi byed dang // gang zhig don rgyas pa dang sna tshogs 'brel dang go byed smra ba dang ; / gang zhig snying la dge rtsa bskyed pa de ni smra byed mkhas pa yin //
translated: He is not harsh when others dispute with him, nor is he sweet when he is praised or successful. He is a skillful speaker who plants the roots of virtue in the hearts of others.

analyzed: tshig su bcad pa 'dis ni smra ba po rnam pa gnyis kyi yon tan rnam pa gnyis bstan par grag ste /
translated: This verse shows the two qualities of the two kinds of speakers.

analyzed: smra ba po rnam pa gnyis ni rang gi phyogs 'dzugs pa dang / chos ston pa'o //
translated: The two kinds of speakers are those who establish their own position and those who teach the Dharma.

original: yon tan rnam pa gnyis ni ngag yongs su dag ba dang / sems yongs su dag ba'o //
analyzed: yon tan rnam pa gnyis ni ngag yongs su dag ba dang / sems yongs su dag ba'o //
translated: The two qualities are the purity of speech and the purity of mind.

original: de la dang po'i ngag yongs su dag pa ni gzhan gyis brgal ba na snyan par smra ba nyid dang / mi snyan pa mi smra ba nyid kyis so //
analyzed: de la dang po'i ngag yongs su dag pa ni gzhan gyis brgal ba na snyan par smra ba nyid dang / mi snyan pa mi smra ba nyid kyis so //
translated: The first kind of purity of speech is the quality of speaking sweetly when others dispute with him and not speaking harshly.

analyzed: sems yongs dag pa ni bsngags pa dang / rgyal ba thob kyang de'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa mi skye bas so //
translated: The purity of mind is due to the absence of the arising of the secondary defilements of pride, etc., even when one has attained praise and victory.

original: gnyis pa'i ngag yongs su dag pa ni yongs su rdzogs pa dang / mi zlog pa dang / tshad ma dang mi 'gal ba'i don dang / gsal ba'i tshig brjod pa nyid kyis so //

translated: The purity of speech of the second is due to the completion of the teaching, the absence of reversal, the expression of words that are not contradicted by validating cognition, and the expression of clear words.

original: sems yongs su dag pa ni dpag dang gzhan gyi rgyud la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'i bsam pa'i sems zang zing med pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: sems yongs su dag pa ni dpag dang gzhan gyi rgyud la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'i bsam pa'i sems zang zing med pa nyid kyis so //
translated: The purity of mind is due to the absence of material motives in the mind that has the intention of generating the roots of virtue in the mental continuum of others.

analyzed: ji ltar mi'i sgo bud @134b shing yin //
translated: Just as a door bolt is for humans,
